reviews.text: During a pandemic you would think CF would have a working outdoor patio.  Nope!  It was a pleasant 61 outside and no wind--and both outdoor patios were closed.  Very frustrating.

*****UPDATE: We ended up being asked to come back and ask for the manager to make sure they redeem themselves after our initial visit. But, even before our server found out that we were a unique table, she was already going above and beyond to make our visit a good one! This time, our food was prompt, delicious, and fresh! The service was pleasant, attentive, and perfect! Glad we decided to go back because they tried to make it right and provide us a gift card to fix the issues. We will be back! Thanks for making it right! <br><br>******Previous visit: I really wanted to love my visit especially because it was where my coworkers took me for my birthday lunch. Although some of the food was great, most did not meet the mark. Our biggest complaint would have to be time. It took two hours from being seated to finally getting our food and only being able to eat half of it because we wanted cheesecake and could not spend the entire day there. Two hour lunch. It was ridiculous. The wait for every little thing was just soooooooo loooooong. I cannot stress how long we had to wait for everything. Our drinks went all the way down and sat empty for 20 min+ before getting refilled. It was like that between every time our server checked on us. It took forever to even get cheesecake. It&#39;s already plated in a fridge, idk why it took so long. Then they mixed up our checks and it took another 20 min to get that sorted. Yeah I&#39;ll probably come here if I want cheesecake but definitely don&#39;t need to waste so much time of my life on dining in here. Also my food was super greasy it gave me acid reflux and didn&#39;t even have much sauce. They need to work on a lot of things for me to go

I went with a few friends for belated birthday celebrations. It took no time to be seated. Our waiter introduced himself, we ordered drinks, then started looking at the menu. I appreciated the QR Code menu &amp; the actual menu availability as well. There were so many items on the menu! There were 25 pages to look through on my phone &amp; we were all very overwhelmed. I ordered a Pineapple Moscow Mule, which was delightful! Then I ordered a Georgia Peach. It was okay; not the best drink &amp; definitely did not compare to the mule. I ordered Avocado Egg Rolls for an appetizer &amp; the Tomato Basil Pasta. The egg rolls were amazing, but the tomato basil was very heavy on the basil; I could barely eat it. I ordered a Salted Caramel Cheesecake &amp; it was phenomenal. Overall it was a good restaurant; might go again but definitely would need to research the food beforehand.

Service was outstanding.  Drinks refilled without asking.  Our server was Clint and he was phenomenally superb!  Food was good with huge portions.  My granddaughter&#39;s chicken sandwich was the biggest I have ever seen.  She struggled as she inhaled the sandwich and finally finished it.  My husband said his fettuccine was perfect, and our grandson had spaghetti and meatballs.  He didn&#39;t come up for air until he ate everything!  Amazing how much this 10 year old ate....more than I could.  This was a first for me to not continually look for our server to top off our drinks.  Clint was there filling our drinks w/o being asked.  Such a rarity!  I had a club sandwich and a small salad.  Bacon was crispy and the bread was toasted with a nice crunch.  I ended up taking half the sandwich home.

Had an amazing time eating there on my anniversary, best Chicken Alfredo EVER! Best Bacon Bacon cheeseburger of all time, splendid bacon, and to top it all off ended the night with an amazing red velvet cheesecake, wallauh best restaurant ever!

Wow!! I walk 30 ft from the door to the hostess stand after waiting an hour and a half and then you inform me I need a face mask to walk 20 ft to my table or you won&#39;t seat me unless I have one. Your rules are pointless and asinine. It makes zero sense to require a mask to my table but not sitting at the table or to the restroom or to exit the restaurant.

We reserved a table using the Yelp app and were able to be seated as soon as we arrived. While I have gone to The Cheesecake Factory many times, this was the first time I ordered the Ribeye. The Ribeye was very tender and was perfect with their mashed potatoes. I ordered a meal to go and it was ready as soon as I was ready to leave.

In town for one night and hotel restaurant was closed. Thought I would play it safe and get Cheesecake Factory! Ordered Bang Bang Shrimp and Orange chicken. Bang bang had NO sauce- so basically got tempura shrimp. Shrimp was ok- but it&#39;s all about the sauce! <br>Orange chicken- also no sauce! So basically chicken tempura! Again- all the flavor is in the sauce!<br>Thing to remember- check ur food before you leave!

Food: 4/5<br>Service: 4/5<br>Cleanliness: 4/5<br>Decor &amp; Style: 5/5<br><br>I still really like the Chicken Bellagio here after all these years. It&#39;s not an amazing 5/5, but good enough to where it makes me crave it once every 1-2 years. I love the mixture of pesto and arugula. The hazelnut cheesecake is great!<br>Definitely will come back here next year for the same exact item!

After reading a review about the long wait for food we were hesitant to come here but we had a gift card we wanted to use. We got to the restaurant at 11am on a Sunday. They were not at all busy. There were 2 young ladies at the hostess station. They asked how many were going to be eating. It was just me and my husband  they told us to &#34;wait over there&#34;. We could see lots of people working and also that most of the tables were empty. We waited about 5 minutes and were considering leaving. Generally a 5 minute wait is fine but when the restaurant was almost empty we thought we could have been seated immediately.  There were no others waiting to be seated. I also think having read that the service is not good we were biased. Once we were seated our waitress came by immediately and got our drink orders. She brought our drinks and fresh warm bread and butter quickly.  The bread was amazing. Warm and fresh and very good. We had rye and white bread. Both were awesome. <br>She took our order and brought out the food very quickly. My husband had an omelette that was stuffed with all kinds of goodies. He said it was really good. He also had a bowl of fresh fruit which we shared. It was really fresh and tasty. I had the lunch portion of Chicken Romono. It was pretty much chicken Parmesan with spaghetti. The red sauce that was on the spaghetti was really tasty. The portion of noodles was huge. The chicken was more of a lunch sized portion.  We were really happy with the food and the service we received once were were seated. <br>As we were leaving, there was a line of probably 15 people standing and sitting around waiting to be seated. The restaurant was still over half empty.  This seems to be a problem for them. If they were understaffed I would maybe understand but there were lots of servers working.  Other then this issue I would have given them a 5.

I am surprised at how wonderful the beet and avocado salad is. So much so that I failed to notice that there were no avocados on my salad. The other things, radishes, oranges, arugula, beets and toasted quinoa are enough. <br><br>I ordered the passion mint fizz which is good and could be wonderful if they&#39;d muddle the mint. <br><br>The Very Cherry Ghirardelli Chocolate Cheesecake is really good. <br><br>The staff is wonderful. My friend wanted a Frappuccino which they don&#39;t have, but I told them to make a chocolate milkshake with two shots of espresso and it was a score.
Love this place, waiter even brought out our cheesecake plate with mom and dad on it after asking us if we were celebrating anything. Yes it is expensive but food has always been solid.

We went for my parents 40th anniversary dinner, and had a fairly good time. It was by no means our first trip, but it is not normally a place that I enjoy. It is fun for a group though. There was no wait, which is  always a plus. And while it is loud, the booths are private enough to provide some privacy. However, service was a bit below par tonight. Our server just didn&#39;t seem all that interested in being there. <br><br>One of the great things about The Cheesecake Factory are the cocktails, which are always great. The food has always been the turnoff for me. Not that it tastes bad, just that there are so many hidden calories that you can eat 3,000 in one meal and believe that you were eating &#34;healthy.&#34; Especially when the salads have more calories than the steaks. The good news is, and the reason for the 4 stars instead 3, is that they have increased the size of their &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; - low calorie - menu. Lots of great choices for under 600 calories. That&#39;s better than almost anywhere. I&#39;ll be back for that alone. <br><br>Overall, it was a good night. Glad we came back

Best Belgian Waffle E.V.E.R. <br><br>Idk what they put in that batter, but Lord Jesus it&#39;s good. The powder sugar just sweetens (literally) the deal. <br><br>The fruit bowl...a miss. They add something funky and it makes the entire thing not so good. <br><br>Their customer service is also a miss for me sometimes. It will be crappy hostess staff, but good waiters/waitresses. It&#39;s never consistent though. <br><br>But that waffle....always on point. I go for that and that only, cause the other menu items are also a miss for me.

Came with a large group of 20 for company holiday party. Always impressed with the service, but especially impressed given how many of us there were. Food is always hot and fresh, well seasoned. Good cheesecake of course. I know people like to talk trash cause it&#39;s a chain, but it&#39;s a good chain - and I&#39;ve never had a bad experience here.
Consistently good! You can depend on being able to split an entree and their salads are huge!<br>We are only a few blocks away and you can order &#34;to go&#34; and it&#39;s ready when you get there!

Even during the covid 19 pandemic they still produce great food great service and excellent cheesecakes. We had good waiters and waitresses here before but Brandon P. Goes babove and beyond even with the little details he does as a waiter.

I mean come on???? Who doesn&#39;t love this place? Huge menu, great food, friendly staff and of course, the CHEESECAKE!!! <br><br>This place is great for big groups or a nice night for a date night. It can be a bit pricey when you order and appetizer, main course, cheesecake and drinks so bring your wallet. I asked to was dishes I. The back but they don&#39;t allow that I guess. Smh. Haha. <br><br>My favorites are the Sweet Corn Tamale Cakes, Chicken Marsala and every one of their cheesecakes. The menu is huge so you cant go wrong there! <br><br>Enjoy!

Went here for our 5th wedding anniversary (being a special place for us) and they wouldn&#39;t sit us inside cause my husband forgot his mask, EVEN THOUGH I had mine. Who wants to sit outside when it&#39;s gonna be chilly?

For my birthday back in March I chose The Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;m so glad I did because they did not disappoint.<br><br>Arrived on a Sunday morning just as they opened for the day. We were pleasantly surprised to be able to choose from brunch or lunch menus. The only problem was there are so many options on the menu we had a hard time deciding what to get. Our server Aubrey was very helpful in making our decisions. She knew the menu quite well! We finally decided on chicken pot stickers as a starter, chicken and waffles for my boyfriend and I had the Chicken Riesling dish. Everything was brought our quickly, hot and delicious! For dessert we of course had a slice of the Mango Lime Cheesecake and I was treated with a FREE birthday mini sundae! They offered to sing to me as well... We passed on that extra! Lol<br><br>Aubrey&#39;s service was above and beyond. She treated me like a Queen on my birthday. You can tell she enjoys what she does! I honestly had a most enjoyable time on this Sunday morning! <br><br>Thank you Cheesecake Factory for the impeccable service!! Especially your wonderful server Aubrey for making me feel so special on my day!

Our visit this time was a mixed bag. We have had many birthdays at various locations throughout the country (Madison,Wi - SFO - Oklahoma - Kansas City) but this by far unfortunately was our worst. While a worst at CF still warrants a decent review it is likely to give us serious pause as to if it is worth returning, or if our high end check is better place sampling a local cheesecake venue.<br><br>The pros: <br>Great Cheesecake <br>Professional apology and service from the manager<br>Friendly, upbeat server who did her level best<br>Smiling happy daughter eating cheesecake for her b-day<br>These buffered the Venues rating considerably and shouldn&#39;t be dismissed. It takes a lot to come to<br>The table and say hey our artichokes aren&#39;t right and get something else out to the table before everyone finishes Deseret particularly on a busy evening.<br><br>The cons:<br>Under cooked artichoke which was then burnt in an attempt to cook through on the grill, served with the heart removed. Most likely because it didn&#39;t survive the charring. (Conflict was resolved acceptably by sending back the artichoke  and aforementioned apology provided, they removed the cost of the artichoke and charged me for my veggie burger).<br><br>Incorrect item served to birthday girl, it happens (should have been Asian and was Mexican tacos) we sent back simultaneously w artichoke, again item was replaced with correct item and we paid for the consumer item.<br><br>Food, even prior to the errors was staged poorly and delivered at various times - acceptable in various cultures, however we&#39;re in the Midwest celebrating a birthday and would have preferred to eat together, and that is the typically the standard of service anticipated based on our location.<br><br>Over all, if this was the sum of our experience with CF we would never go again, still we know some days in food service suck, and hence will likely try again, and when we do I know we&#39;ll likely have a better overall review. <br><br>It happens.

I came here with a group for lunch on New Years Eve Day. It was pretty crowded, but we only had to wait about 20 minutes. The parking lot was kind of crazy and took a while to find some parking. The Cheesecake Factory has a parking lot by it, but the larger parking area is for the mall just across the lot. <br><br>I&#39;ve been to many Cheesecake Factory&#39;s and they are all pretty consistent with quality and service. Their menu is all the same, we knew what to expect. I ordered my favorite &#34;skinny&#34; asian chicken salad. They have their normal menu and then a &#34;skinny menu&#34;. I usually just order off the skinny menu because they are so many delicious options that are healthier. The items on this menu are not too different from the ones off the regular menu, so why not eat something yummy and healthier?! Everyone enjoyed their food.<br><br>Our waiter was good, but kind of awkward, it was weird. Not weird bad or weird good, just ... hmm ok that was awkward, but the service was satisfactory. I&#39;d come again!
The Cheesecake Factory never lets me down with the food. Slightly expensive, but large portions and tasty dishes compensate for it. I always recommend out of peak hours.

I love the Cheesecake Factory ! Great atmosphere usually have an amazing waitress or waiter ! <br>Went there today for a lunch date with my better half no wait at 2pm. That was shocking but loved that we were seated immediately ! <br>Husband got the Cajun littles which is chicken tenders it&#39;s his favorite not spicy at all ! Very fresh you can tell it was t sitting around ! I got the Pasta Cabanaro with Chicken which is really good ! I can never finish it but hey score guess I don&#39;t need to cook ( lol ). We also got the Chocolate Tuxedo Cheesecake to split and to go !! <br>Waitress was great , &amp; friendly .. She was a little slower than usual but it was busy so I just believe she was at other tables .
Went in today for lunch &amp; got the Louisiana Chicken Pasta. It was very tasty. And my server... he was phenomenal, wish I remembered his name so that I could give him his props.

The food is sub par. Especially for the prices. The waitress was friendly. One person in our party got food that was so bad it was inedible and that was after they told us they&#39;d served the first plate they fixed to to wring table meaning we had to wait an additional ten minutes. I doubt I&#39;ll be back. Per usual the cheesecake was about the only thing worth the trip.

Classic Cheesecake Factory experience here: everything and the kitchen sink is on their menu. It&#39;s all served family style (one order is enough for a family of three-across the board). <br><br>My staple is the Louisiana chicken pasta. It&#39;s so subtly spicy and flavorful and a HUGE portion. One time at this location we found a hair (an obvious &#34;there&#39;s no way it&#39;s mine&#34; hair) in this dish. Staff was apologetic. They removed it from our check and replaced the dish with another one, which was the acceptable way to handle the situation. <br><br>Recently tried the Nashville chicken appetizer and it was good. I like the flavor-there could have been more pickles and a lot less grease. <br><br>Recently tried the Tuscan chicken from the Skinny-licious menu. There was enough meal there for 3 people; completely shareable for dinner for two with leftovers. The farro was skimpy, but I guess that&#39;s where the Skinny-licious part comes in. It was served with tons of tomatoes and had great flavor. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory cheesecake is universal at all locations, which I appreciate. Love the white chocolate raspberry. Recently learned a piece of cheesecake is somewhere in the neighborhood of 1,000-ish calories. Plan ahead and bring a cheesecake buddy (or several) who have similar tastes to you, or plan to take a week to eat it.

I recommend just going for the cheesecake. The service is not very good and the food is subpar. The cheesecake is worth the price and is super delicious. <br><br>However, after they reopened after COVID we placed an online order and it was a DISASTER. There was a line out the door to place a to go order. The line was so busy we couldn&#39;t call to even tell them we were here to pick up our order. There were 17 different pickup spots in the parking lot for curbside pickup, and those were all full along with every regular parking spot filled with people waiting to be helped. The people running the food out were so sweet, however there was not enough help at all. The place was busy. Me and my boyfriend called probably 20 times trying to catch the line when it wasn&#39;t busy. The lady next to us said she sat in her car waiting an HOUR on cheesecake. <br>In conclusion, I&#39;m not blaming Cheesecake Factory because they were extremely busy, however if you&#39;re considering ordering take out from here, I would recommend skipping it until the inside opens back up.

Disclaimer - I&#39;m usually not a big chain eater. I try to eat local. That being said, I&#39;m always a huge fan of cheesecake and my boss got me a gift card for the Cheesecake Factory. So, after a long morning of Black Friday shopping, we were starving and a little on the broke side. Cheesecake Factory, here we come. I&#39;ve eaten at this particular location before and the one thing I don&#39;t much care for is the seating. If you&#39;re unlucky enough to get crammed into the long row of tables that has you eating in the lap of the patron next to you - I feel your pain because I&#39;ve eaten in that exact way before. However, this time, we were seated in a booth next to a window and had plenty of room. Our server was a sweet girl who immediately took our order and brought us our drinks. We ordered the fried zucchini and the cheeseburger Wong tongs. Delicious. Those hamburger Wong tongs were dangerous, with their crispy outside shell and ooey gooey cheeseburger inside. I had to push them toward my husband or I would have eaten the whole plate. The zucchini were also amazing - but I justify demolishing that plate because, after all, zucchini is a vegetable and therefore the fried part is cancelled out by the veggie component.<br>I had the Cobb salad. Even with the shortage of Romaine lettuce, the iceberg was fresh and crisp and piled high with crispy bacon, egg, avocado, and blue cheese crumbles.  While I initially thought I would get ranch dressing, it came with the CF&#39;s house vinaigrette and was actually very good.<br>My husband ordered the club sandwich. It was HUGE. The only criticism is that the bread was this beautiful crusty baguette that was just too crunchy and hurt the roof of his mouth. It was a little off putting because the description says &#34;white bread&#34; and while this technically WAS white bread, it was white baguette bread. I would have eaten the entire thing regardless, but some of us are more willing to sacrifice our pallets than others. <br>This visit we were too full for dessert, but, we will be back. Cheesecake Factory treated us right and fed us good. I see you Cheesecake Factory and even with your big chain name, you took the time to make me feel welcomed and allowed me to relax and unwind with my favorite person over delicious apps and lunch.

We came in on the WRONG Saturday...tax free weekend near the mall. Neither here nor there, we got seated in about 6 minutes, really not bad for a Saturday evening.<br>It took about 5 minutes for our drink order to be taken, then another 5 to order our apps. We then ordered our main meal, and waited...and waited...and waited.<br>After around 15 mins the apps came out, and were outstanding. My wife had the Asian Style Chicken Lettuce Wraps, I had the Cheeseburger Egg Rolls (don&#39;t judge, lol). As we were wrapping up with the apps, the main meal came, like on cue. My wife had the combo of Steak Diane/Herb-crusted Salmon with steamed spinach. I had the Factory Burrito Grande, again, don&#39;t judge.<br>The Steak Diane was OMG good, the salmon could have been less cooked, but was good nonetheless. The spinach had a good taste, was cooked quite well, not overcooked. The burrito was also very good, much better than I expected. For dessert, we both had cheesecake...of course. It took an exorbitant amount of time to get it, other than that, no review needed, as it was superb.<br>The food was a 4/5, service 3/5, ambience 4/5.
This place is one of the most consistent great restaurants in okc!! Best dessert for sure. Highly recommended

I&#39;ve said it before, and I&#39;ll say it again: The Cheesecake Factory (TCF) is where willpower and waistlines go to die. And my goodness, it&#39;s so easy to fail at any healthy eating attempts if this place becomes a frequent stop for you.<br><br>Supposedly, their 250 menu items are made from scratch daily, which makes me want to know what their definition of &#34;from scratch&#34; is more than anything. Prices have gone up though, so really, this is increasingly becoming a great place to get your dessert fix only, since there are definitely better options for dining out, even by chain restaurant standards. Our meal with family ended up being just slightly shy of $140. That&#39;s Cheever&#39;s money at that point. Speaking of increased prices... This happened yesterday:<br><br>[] Update at the bottom of this essay [] I ordered something called the &#34;Crispy Chicken Costoletta&#34; listed on the menu at $17.95. &#34;Whatever&#34; I thought, since most everything on the menu is in that range. I figured the portions were going to be massive, so yay. Then the bill arrived, and I noticed that I was charged $19.45 for the CCC. <br><br>So I ask my server for clarification. I even had to point it out on the menu because he didn&#39;t seem like he believed me. A few minutes later, he comes back and tells me that his manager said that the prices had gone up on a number of the menu items by &#34;just a dollar&#34; (it&#39;s more than a dollar, but who&#39;s counting? Besides me...). And then he asked if it would be okay for me to go ahead and pay the $19.45. lolwut? <br><br>There were a number of options on how to deal with the price change(s):<br>        (a) Take the low-effort Asian restaurant route, and cover the old price with a sticker.<br>        (b) Eat the cost of your mistake, and fix the price when requested by the customer.<br>        (c) Ask the customer politely to accept your bait &amp; switch.<br><br>He actually chose (c) and with manager approval too, it seems. I mean, yes, it&#39;s only $1.50, but I was like &#34;WTH?&#34; to even being told: <br><br>- Yeah, our prices changed... <br>- Yeah, we didn&#39;t note it anywhere... <br>- Yeah, could you go ahead and just pay the new price?<br><br>No, guy. No. I mean, thanks for asking so nicely, but this was like the easiest customer-service resolution ever, and you botched it. And this weak-sauce customer service thing is the one thing (other than the delicious cheesecake) that seems to be oddly consistent about this TCF in particular.<br><br>Man, this review got long... <br><br>P. S. I had someone from &#34;Guest Services&#34; reach out to me, to explain that you cannot do any substitutions. At all. The server had told me that I could swap out the mashed potatoes for the corn succotash, and it turns out that... You can&#39;t... So, yeah... Crispy Chicken Costoletta ($17.95) + Corn Succotash ($1.50) = $19.45. Okay, fair enough...

It turns out that the best day to go is Tuesday at 11 AM. My group was about 25 to 30 people; all on separate checks, everyone ordering different meals and drinks. We were seated right away at a prepared table. Two wait staff introduced themselves and told us what group they would be responsible for. They took our orders and left. They brought the drinks and bread to munch on. It was a work related function and a presentation of gifts and a speech took place. All of the waitstaff waited prior to refilling drinks, instead of interrupting. I thought that was thoughtful. I had a sandwich from the guilt free menu which came with a salad. I was fairly full after the sandwich so, I didn&#39;t have the salad. I did get the wrong soft drink once and a while, but I thought that was minor. <br><br>Based on my last experience at the Cheesecake Factory, I would have never returned (2-Star) rating for service and excessive wait times). It was only because work had this thing there that I went back and I am glad I did. I was pleasantly surprised. I wonder, was that a management issue or was it a weekend issue. Either way, pleasant experience. A little pricey, but I couldn&#39;t leave without a coffee and carrot cake in a to go container.

You know what to expect when you go to the cheesecake factory and for that I am satisfied even if everything is overpriced when compared to the quality! Cucumber martinis are a must if you&#39;re looking to spend a buck on top of your food and dessert purchases.

Love this place. Large menu always allows me to order something new and switch it up. Never disappointed. Come here at least once a month. Good sandwiches, good chicken, good pasta, and most importantly great cheesecake.

If you want a restaurant with a lot of everything this is your place! I&#39;m not a fan of cheesecake but I will forever return for Linda&#39;s fudge cake. This is a great spot for picky eaters because you can basically customize everything on the menu. Some items on the menu seem pricey but the portions are huge so you can split meals with friends or save leftovers for an additional meal. Unfortunately, the last time I was at this location, the entry area (where they keep the cheesecake) smelled a bit funky with a mixture of bleach, which isn&#39;t very inviting.

Just your typical every day Cheesecake Factory with their gigantic book of a menu. Good thing about it is, you can literally substitute anything for anything. Want the salmon pasta but love rice? Swap it out! Want a side of guacamole with your steak? Easy. You could have Mexican, Italian, Asian, and American, all on one plate. Then finish it off with tons of cheesecake! Our waitress was super helpful for us and our specific food needs, staff here are so friendly so that was awesome. Overall great experience!

I would give it a 4 star if the price was worth it. The food look good &amp; tasted good but the price is just to high specially for a slice of cheese cake for $7.95 it should be more like $5.95 in my opinion. The meal averaging $15.95 &amp; up adding a side salad to the meal then maybe worth it. I will go back but only for dessert then I wouldn&#39;t mind paying $8 bucks maybe. Service was good you end up having like 3 different people coming to your table from one taken your order on your drinks to another ordering your meal to another delivering your food that must be why the prices are so high got so many employees.
We had the pizza lunch we had the strip scampi we had the spaghetti and meatballs everything was excellent Amanda was our server and she did a wonderful job to definitely a go back to place.
Food was good, nothing spectacular and a little overpriced but the Hershey&#39;s Cheesecake was so so good! I would go back for the dessert for sure!

We like the Cheesecake Factory, always have. But, since moving to OKC, this location just does not give off that special vibe. The food is still tasty. The kids menu has a lot of selections. We enjoy the options for both healthy and well tasty, totally worth the calories selections. Ha! We have been to this location about 3 times. Today we were sat near the bathroom and well that is not a desired location. The waiter was not as attentive, but he tried. The appetizer came out 5 minutes before the main meal. The wait for the food in general was a little too slow, especially for a lunch hour. The slices of cheesecake and flavor options are wonderful! We will still return, we just can not figure out why we do not get the warm fuzzy from this location yet.

My family drove an hour because grandchildren wanting to eat there. We were told they wouldn&#39;t seat us at the same table because there were 7 of us. We informed them that we were family and came in the same vehicle. We were 3 adults and 4 children. Needless to say we left and went elsewhere. Also, we won&#39;t go back. One star only to post.

Decided to Come in for lunch on a Tuesday since I didn&#39;t have my baby and enjoy lunch by myself. If you want a restaurant that has a ton of variety, this is your perfect spot! The menu is literally like a book.<br><br>If you want a meal that is healthy and you are watching calories stick to the skinny licious menu only!! All of their dishes are not known to be the healthiest. Plus they give you delicious warm bread and butter while you wait for your food. I love their butter here it&#39;s so fresh. <br><br>I got the Renee special which is a half a turkey sandwich, House salad, and a cup of the soup of the day. My soup I got was chicken tortilla which was so cold and just not good at all. It was thicker than tomato soup almost and not a single tortilla chip in it! <br><br>The sandwich was fresh and hearty! salad was delicious but they drowned it in salad dressing and I hate when that happens.<br><br>My waitress was good just slow she definitely wasn&#39;t in any hurry.. which is nice opposed to feeling rushed I guess. I just don&#39;t like it when you give change or place your order then they walk off and talk to two other tables making small talk. <br><br>All in all there are definitely other local favorites I have but if you&#39;re craving bread and of course cheesecake this is the place!

This is a great place for dinner if you have a family or group because their menu is extensive! <br><br>We had the fried macaroni and cheese to start and it was amazing! You get 4 balls and can easily share each one with someone. I had the skinnylicious (under 600 calories) burger and green salad. It was good, but nothing to write home about. The green salad was just lettuce. No other veggies were on the salad. I thought that was odd and the dressing they poured on it made the greens a little soggy. <br><br>Our service was okay, a little slow at times. The weather was perfect, which made for an excellent meal on their patio.

Very good service and cheesecake is beyond amazing!! Our party of 12 was seated quickly and the waitress was so nice. We normally just order desserts to go for parties or special occasions but eating in we were not disappointed. Can&#39;t wait to visit again.

I came here for a nice dinner with family. The lady&#39;s room was not clean. I spotted that someone had a kit boy accident on the floor and it had dried. (Indicating the bathroom has not been cleaned in a few hours) as my party was being seated we found something stuck to the back of our booth. No idea what it was but the staff did not move us to a different booth / table. Needless to say the service was also terrible. I was incredibly shocked because I have never been to a bad Cheesecake Factory but I guess there&#39;s a first time for everything

My family and I used to love coming here. The food was always so good and fresh. The last few times we&#39;ve gone it&#39;s been the opposite. The service has suffered and the food is not the quality it once was. Our teas were sour. The bread wasn&#39;t fresh. Our Mac n cheese balls were cold in the middle and couldn&#39;t eat the Alfredo because the noodles were too chewy. Won&#39;t be back.
Our waitress was awesome!  Good food! Social distancing and lots of protective measures while keeping a great atmosphere!  Thank you for the meal out!

Charlie was my server and he IS AMAZZZZING!!! The calamari was great. The steak was delicious. The drinks were perfect. But the 5 star service from Charlie tied it all together. Will DEFINITELY return.

This used to be such a great place to go. It really does have a nice atmosphere, but the food is a-changing. Portions are smaller...prices still on the high side..and overall just doesn&#39;t taste as good as it once did. I ordered the carrot cake cheesecake because it has always been one of my favorites, but texturally it was not the same. A little on the &#34;gritty&#34; side. I just don&#39;t know. Still love the sweet corn tamale cakes, though!

So I usually like this place but today was very disappointing. We had gnats flying around our booth and when I asked where they were coming from the servers immediate reply was &#34;I don&#39;t see one&#34; and this was directly in front of a manager. The manager asked if we wanted to move but we declined because if you can&#39;t even acknowledge the gnats the problem isn&#39;t going to be solved regardless of where we sit.<br>When my boyfriends dish was dropped off he was missing a side of rice and the sever who dropped it acted like we were wrong and the dish only came with one side stating our sever subbed it out. My boyfriend corrected him and he said he would let our sever know. She came for the rice and apologized explaining that it was suppose to come with the rice. <br>We tried to eat but the gnats kept buzzing around and trying to land on our food. They were also crawling on the window. We immediately packed our food paid and left. For paying over $60 it was an extremely dissatisfying meal, service, and experience.

My husband and I came with the intent of a spontaneous date night dinner. This happens to be one of his favorite spots. Who knew this place would also be great for hiding out with great food, drinks, and fun people while avoiding tornadic weather <br>The bread is a godsend while waiting for orders, especially when they are busy, and lets be honest, when are they NOT busy?! <br>I have to take a moment to sing praises about the crab cake bites! These little morsels of deliciousness melt in your mouth! They are like a satisfying little puff of crab! I was almost depressed when they were gone, and they went quickly! <br>We had the chicken reisling which was AMAZING! I will totally order this again! <br>We finished up the meal with the Reece&#39;s pnut butter cup and chocolate cake cheese cake. You REALLY need a HUGE glass of milk with this one! Or in my case, wine . Milk and I dont get along these days . This was so rich, I could only get 3 bites in before throwing in the towel. But, those were an amazing 3 bites! Of course, we took the rest home! <br><br>The restauraunt is clean, as a whole. Although management may want to stay on top of their busboys....saw one, in particular reset tables without wiping them off. Scary thing is, how many times was this done on the same table with who knows how many people&#39;s leftovers still hanging around. I&#39;m not a germiphobe, but I do appreciate cleanliness. We appropriately and kindly alerted management who immediately rectified the issue of the table. #JustSayin

For a chain restaurant, The Cheesecake Factory has pretty good food.<br><br>The menu is a book with everything you could possibly think of. I&#39;ve tried several of their dishes, but the only category that I found quite disappointing in taste and texture was the pasta.<br><br>The wheat bread and butter is delicious. I&#39;m not a fan of sourdough, so I am biased with my opinion on that.<br><br>With our 20 minute wait, it gave my party plenty of time to look at the menu and pick our entrees. When we were seated, we ordered our drinks and went ahead and ordered our entrees to make things easier on our server (including a bowl of lemons for our water, straws, and extra bread).<br><br>Service took a while. And we had to wait an additional 15 minutes for the items listed above.<br><br>Food was good. I got the steak with salmon with a side of mashed potatoes and corn succotash. The asparagus were wilted and the size of match sticks. My family&#39;s entrees were also satisfying in taste. The server clearly forgot to put in an order and said under her breath as she was thinking, &#34;I&#39;ll get that out as soon as possible.&#34; Not recognizing that she was at fault for this... (We&#39;re usually understanding and nice when we dine out, but I&#39;ll judge if you play it off like we forgot to tell you!!!)... so that kind of left a bad taste in my mouth. <br><br>Anywho, we finished out entrees, already had our meals boxed up and bagged. The server comes back with the missed order and told us it was actually taken to another table and they had to make a new one. Thanks?? We&#39;re clearly full. I was hoping it would get comped since we ordered this from the beginning, she had forgotten, and it came out when we were about to leave. We obviously paid it and took it togo... Tonight, it wasn&#39;t worth the hassle to even mention it. Justified that bad taste in my mouth, but.... whatevs. I noticed there&#39;s never a manager that walks around asking how things are going whenever I&#39;ve visited.<br><br>Cheesecake has always been divine. I recommend the Kahlua or the lemon raspberry. <br><br>Overall, the price is expensive so, expect to easily rack up your bill. I would come back only to order cheesecake or if invited in a group without say.

I had a terrible experience for Mother&#39;s Day. First, I placed an online order at 4 for 7 p.m. pick up. At 6:30 I received an email saying online ordering system had failed to send my order through and that I needed to call the location and place an order. After calling for 10 or 15 minutes, I was finally able to get through and place an telephone order. I was told to park in a numbered spot call in let them know what number and they would bring out my order. When I got there I tried calling for 20 minutes but no one ever answered. I finally had to go inside and stand in the pickup line waiting for my order. When I finally got my order and got home, I discovered that they had left out one of the four cheese cakes and one of the entrees. I know they were busy today, but it was an unacceptable experience.

The Cheesecake Factory is one of those destinations that has everything.  There is no way you could go with a large group and everyone not be satisfied.  Typically, with large menus I am judgmental because I think every must be mediocre because you specialize in nothing.  But, as critical as I want to be most of the menu items are above average.  They have added the calorie count to the menu.  Holy Batman, you have to make a conscious decision to intake the calories.  There is a skinnylicious menu that is helpful for those calorie counting patrons.  Weirdest move on CF, they put the dessert choices in the main menu and you have to request to keep it just to review your dessert choices.  The dessert menu should be separate and a staple at each table.  I would normally review specific items on the menu, but I don&#39;t think you can go wrong and most items are what you expect.  Just like the cheesecake, you pick what you typically like and it will be pretty darn good.  The ambience is loud.  The bill adds up quick.  You can get cheesecake to go.

We recently had food delivered. My wife&#39;s Cobb salad was good. My Bang Bang was not. It was cold and flavorless. Never bothered calling to complain because I have no desire to have my time wasted with excuses. Expensive too.

L&#39;Shawn was our server and he did a great job. <br><br>We started with the Cuban Spring rolls. So delicious! They come with a wonderful sauce to dip in as well.<br><br>Our entrees were an extremely large Caesar salad and the combo. We chose steak Diane (cooked medium rare) and the herb crusted salmon. <br><br>These dishes were fantastic as well. But you can&#39;t go to The Cheesecake Factory and not get dessert! <br><br>We had the White Chocolate Raspberry Truffle, a creamy cheesecake swirled with white chocolate and raspberry and the Lemon Raspberry Cream Cheesecake, a raspberry-vanilla cake, creamy lemon cheesecake, raspberry lady fingers and lemon mousse. <br><br>Both were great, but the lemon one was divine.<br><br>Casual dining at fine dining prices. A treat every once in a while.

This will go on my list of crowdpleaser restaurants: places I go not because I&#39;m seeking culinary enlightenment, but because I am with my entire office and we need a restaurant that we can all agree upon. This isn&#39;t even to say I didn&#39;t like the food - I thought it was pretty good! I had a thai chicken curry dish that I found to be a little too sweet, but the gargantuan portions guaranteed I wouldn&#39;t go hungry for the next couple days. The service was quick and polite, even though we were pretty demanding and asked for individual checks at the end. Altogether a solid experience!

First time at The Cheesecake Factory and the food was simply delicious! We enjoyed a wonderful evening on their patio. It was a busy Saturday night and our waiter, Brandon P., was very attentive and friendly. Great service overall.

Took wife to Cheesecake Factory for her bday. I ordered Marsala chicken. For your information, it is not a little Marsala wine poured over sautéed chicken and a very few mushrooms and placed on top of a huge amount of bow tie pasta! I am not a gourmet chef but mine is way better than yours. No cream, butter or seasonings. Tasteless and very expensive.

Every cheesecake factory is usually the same everywhere I go but this one in OKC is a little different, I ordered the Fried chicken Waffles Benedict and my husband ordered a non brunch item/ kung pao chicken lol .. I had very high expectations since I haven&#39;t ever had time to eat during Sunday Brunch hours so I was very excited. My food however was very, Blah. I didn&#39;t care for it. I honestly think I like their dinner menu is 100X better. We ordered cheesecake as usual but Probably wont be back for the brunch menu.

My boyfriend and I always come here after a shit day and we&#39;ve never been disappointed. The bar always takes great care of us, we&#39;ve been going there for over a year now and only had one average experience as far as service goes, but we also came in really late so there&#39;s nobody to blame. Wish the food was a little bit cheaper bc I want to try to much and a lot of the food doesn&#39;t complete my pallet easily but the food that does I&#39;m OBSESSED with. If you haven&#39;t yet TRY THEIR FRIED EGG ROLLS and thank me later :)

This place is crowded and overpriced but the food is still good. The cheesecake is about $8 slice which to me is crazy but it is really good. I was here for the half price cheesecake day and $4.97 was more in line...

Never ever ever have we received such horrible service.  The waitress was not the best and perhaps the worst I have ever had.  <br><br>I have been to several cheesecake factory&#39;s around the US. This is by far the worst. <br><br>I can&#39;t wait to get back to Texas and go to a cheese cake factory and have some good food and service.

Date night last Friday was super awesome and our server was legit! Our server was very attentive and our drinks never got low. She refilled our bread as I couldn&#39;t resist eating it. The garlic bread if you have never had it is a must try. You can thank me later!! Oh my it&#39;s decadent! Our Louisiana chicken pasta was simply heavenly.  We got cheesecake to go and we&#39;re very pleased with our visit. We definitely will return to this Cheesecake Factory! Thank you again!

Quick / excellent service, even on busy days. The Shepherd&#39;s Pie is definitely worth trying &amp; a favorite is the Chicken Bellagio. And of course there&#39;s the famous cheesecake selection. So good that you have try them all.

I had Vegan Cobb Salad! This was one of the best salads i have had in a very long time. Our server was a little slow but could have just been having a busy day. I also got the mango key lime cheesecake which was super delightful and not super heavy filling!

I came here after having gross hotel food.  I wanted something good and familiar and that&#39;s what I got.  <br><br>The service was slow, my waiter was covering a lot of tables.<br><br>My food was piping hot and tasted good but there were some foreign ingredients that made it into my food.  Since I don&#39;t have food allergies it wasn&#39;t a big deal but something to consider for those with special diets.<br><br>I lost patience waiting on my check so I skipped the cheesecake because I was concerned about how long I&#39;d have to wait...

Met with a friend here and haven&#39;t actually eaten in one of these in over 6 years. I also get the cheese cake and head out.<br><br>Pros:<br>* Decor is nice, updated and it was clean. <br>* Had many cheese cake options, I ended up leaving with an ultimate red velvet and strawberry cheese slice. <br>* My food was good but the red wine sauce was sweet on my meat (not a fan) and if I knew that prior I would have placed it on the side <br>* The kids spaghetti and meatball was a good amount. The meatballs was massive for my kid.<br><br>Cons: <br>* The meal options are a bit much, Gordon Ramsey would definitely get rid of half there menu lol.<br>* I know I was in Oklahoma but the biggest steak they had was 10 oz. If you get a steak and shrimp,chicken or salmon combination the steak is only 5 oz and the fish is only 4 or 5 for about $23.00. My food was good but the wine sauce was not to my liking and the portions were little but the plate was long. <br>*When I initially asked the waitress how many ounces is the meats, since it&#39;s not on the menu she answered with &#34;its a lot on the plate&#34; : - /<br>*The drinks are over $3.00 for tea or soda<br>*Cheesecake is about $8-10 a slice<br>* The waitress said you have to order the cheesecake from the table or you have to pay individually. This is after I already had the bill on my table. <br>* Our waitress was new, didn&#39;t know much about the menu and took Forrrrrevvvveerrrr to bring me my check even though she was walking back and forth past me. <br>* The bill shows you the gratuity if 15% plus. For a kids meal, my food and two pieces of cheese cake it was over $65<br><br>Overall I think if I am going to spend $65 for me and a kid again it will be in Texas where the prices and portions compliment one another. I can feed my husband to and I won&#39;t have to wonder what I am getting. I&#39;ll stick to just picking up the cheese cake in this place.

I went here last night for a going away party. I had called that morning and see if I could RSVP some seats, but the lady on the phone said they don&#39;t do that at night - which I totally understand. I said that was fine and we would arrive 30 minutes early to try and retrieve a table.<br><br>My party was arriving early and we were able to snag a table outside but 80% of our party had to be there - which is reasonable. We then saw some open seating and I ask the front workers if we could go ahead and take 3 tables over there. She said &#34;hold on, let me check.&#34; After a few seconds, the manager comes over and asks me about my question. I was shocked that the manager came up to me, which is fine, but I would like to be told something like &#34;let me get my manager to discuss this further.&#34;<br><br>I told the manager the situation: if we could give up our seating outdoors for the open seating indoors. She asked if I was the host of the party and I said I was. She said that area is for open seating only and not big parties, but that they will go ahead and seat us outside. (It was nice of them to go ahead and take down the 80% threshold, but I felt like they didn&#39;t want us to sit at the area inside and I still felt like she wasn&#39;t really answering my questions because I just wanted to understand the situation, which is why I was asking questions and I wanted to be cooperative).<br><br>The service was kind of slow. Our waiter was nice, but would have been nice to be checked on more often since our party had different requests. When they brought out our food, it was different people that kept asking our group who had what. Shouldn&#39;t the waiter be doing that? I understand that restaurants get busy and other people can bring out the food, but shouldn&#39;t you be partnering with the waiter or waitress since they know what everybody ordered?<br><br>I have always loved Cheesecake Factory, but I think this will be the last time I will go to this location. The state/city that I&#39;m moving to has a lot of Cheesecake Factories so I will definitely be going to those. I hope everybody else had a pleasant time at this location. Like I said, I&#39;m a very understanding person - just work and talk with me and I will have no issues. Thanks!

I called in an order for the curb side pick up, they said it would be complete at a certain time. I pulled up to the slot assigned for pick up and called the number listed. I was told they would pass it on that I was waiting for my order. 10 minutes later nothing, so I went inside to see what had happened, to which I was told they thought I said Dillion for my name, so I&#39;m thinking we did this on line, they took down the make and model of my car, did you even go out and look for my car? Pure incompetence. Don&#39;t offer a service if you cannot provide that service.

The food is so-so even though the variety is phenomenal. <br><br>They are REALLY strict about promos-we went for half off Cheesecake day and they would only give us one slice half off <br><br>The staff seems overwhelmed and there is always a wait!<br><br>The ambience is dressy but there are always people there in flip flops.

We haven&#39;t been in a while , food was good. The prices are kind of on the higher side for what they serve.  The cheesecake selection was really good. Staff was nice. <br>We honestly won&#39;t go again for a while. <br>I can get the same foods at other restaurants for about the same to slightly cheaper and those restaurants be specialized in certain foods and maybe a tad bit better tasting.
Kind of pricey but the food is good and portions are huuuuge. Had a really nice server. My favorite food here was the complimentary bread.

Our experience here goes down hill every time we go.. it&#39;s honestly not even worth going when we get a gift card anymore (when we receive a gift card is the ONLY time we go and quite frankly I&#39;d rather just give the gift card away instead of eat here). Food is always wrong, old and/ or not the right temp (hot salad/ cold entree) and service is almost non existent which is most times not the servers fault because the sections are broken up so terribly. Will NOT be back
Not worth the money whatsoever. The menu is so big that they can&#39;t execute anything... taste like it came out of the freezer. Dated decor and slow staff.

You can&#39;t go wrong with TCF, and this location never disappoints. The menu never changes, but why should it since it is about 8 pages.<br><br>My wife always gets the Tea, it has a unique flavor with hints of fruit. It gives me the willies so I pass. But go for it if it&#39;s your bag.<br><br>The absolute always order, no questions asked, is the chicken pot stickers as an appetizer. The sauce is spectacular, I never let any go to waste by sponging it up with the delicate stickers or delicious fresh bread.<br><br>Tonight I was feeling adventurous. So I exchanged my usual, Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp (I&#39;m a curry junkie) for the Miso Salmon. And let me tell you, it changed my life. Who knew salmon could taste so great in Oklahoma? The fish was fresh, flaked properly, and was covered in a Miso sauce that was oh so creamy fantastic. <br><br>I passed on cheesecake tonight. But recommend the Red Velvet. It has the most  calories of them all. Enough said.

This was not the greatest Cheesecake Factory experience. The service was okay. It seemed like other tables waiters were helping us more than our own. <br><br>My food was excellent. I had the Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta. Everything about it was great, but it wasn&#39;t as spicy as I wanted it to be. My father had the Chicken Riesling. The taste was meh. It was also really oily. When you took a bite you could just taste the oil coat your mouth. My mom had the Chicken Parmesan Pizza Style. For the most part it was good. It was pretty average, nothing that was really surprising or great about it. My sister had the Santa Fe Chicken Salad. Her food was amazing as always. One of the best salads at any restaurant. My Grandma had the Southwest Chicken Sandwich. This was really good. Because the bread was so fresh, it made the sandwich absolutely amazing.

Extremely over priced for the quality of food. Could find much tastier food else where for a way cheaper price. Have 3 stars only because the Cheesecake was amazing. However I Wouldn&#39;t recommend the food.

Everything was great except when I addressed the manager on the floor(5&#39;4&#34; brunette with highlights and curly hair) about my concerns about our wine that was NOT presented tableside and arrived 15 minutes AFTER it was ordered. I understand new staff arrangements, but also understand a price point and it&#39;s standards and expectations. I&#39;ll definitely be back based on the food quality, however I hope to have a more satisfactory night out when I arrive.

This was terrible. Terrible terrible terrible. (Sounds better if you pretend Charles Barkley is saying it) I wanted to grab a quick bite with the family before I headed out town for work. I let my daughter pick and she picked here. This place always sounds better than it is. <br><br>From the beginning it was terrible. They asked if I had any children in the party. (I get this. I was single and childless once but. Come on. Let&#39;s not be so obvious). I said yes and they sat me in the worst table by the kitchen. I sure hope the waiter I had was new because he was terrible. About 10 minutes from being seated to him coming to the table. Then. He dropped off the menus  and I had to stop him from leaving to give him a drink order. It got worse from there. Like I said. I hope he was new. <br><br>The food was gross. My daughter got garlic noodles. Obvious garlic salt and I think they spilled it in there. It was saltier than anything I have ever had. I probably should check my blood pressure. <br><br>I had sausage and shrimp. Sauce was terrible and the sausage had about as much a presence as you will see in a women&#39;s locker room. <br><br>Children&#39;s menu was typical of a place that really doesn&#39;t want children. <br><br>Dessert. Couple pieces of cheese cake. I really do not see what the hype is.  There was obviously no real baker back there. Frozen????<br><br>The bill was $129. Not cheap. I could have gone to one of the new fun restaurants in OKC for that price. <br><br>Stay away.
This place is soooooooo awesome every time I&#39;m in a state that has a Cheesecake Factory I have to hit it up and try all kinds...Honey Truffle Chicken and Strawberry shortcake is my favorite...

Do not know who decided their lasagne recipe, but it was one gooey cheesy mess and I could not taste one ingredient that is specific to this dish.  It was literally flavorless.  It was layered in stringy cheese.

This is the only cheesecake factory in okc that&#39;s the reason for the 25min wait time any time in the weekend. This is my God knows how many times visit as I love this place. I ordered raspberry lemonade to drink and some tex Mex appetizer which was great as usual and salmon with mashed potatoes, the salmon today was not that great but everything else was exceptional good. I will be back

Came here with my parents and i ordered the chicken strips with fries and raspberry lemonade. I loved my food but tried a piece or ribeye from my dad&#39;s plate and it was horrible, also tried one buffalo chicken from my brother and it wasn&#39;t tasting good either. We had tex mex egg roll as appetizer and ot was awesome.

Came here during the labor day weekend and got seated after a 20min wait because it was really busy. We had an amazing and attentive waitress which is the only reason why I did not drop this to 2 stars. I had the rib eye with mashed potatoes and green beans, really really worse piece of steak I&#39;ve ever had. No taste and full of fat, the mashed potatoes was ok and the beans were fine too. Our waitress kept our raspberry lemonade full all the time :)

Four stars because the atmosphere was great on a date night with my husband. He had the steak tacos-he liked them. I had the steak medallions-they were ok: I was expecting it to taste like steak slices and they tasted more like Salisbury steak.I enjoyed the asparagus,mushrooms, and tomatoes the most on the dish! Nice place

Completely unremarkable experience. We were looking for a place with diverse options and ended up here, just to give it a try and see how it is...<br>My burger was totally average (medium cold fries) and the shrimp pasta plate was bland, the plate arrived with a bunch of pasta sauce at the bottom of the plate with a bunch of boiled pasta on top, not mixed, not combined... TERRIBLE.

My boss gave me a gift card for my birthday, so we came here (hadn&#39;t been in a while). My husband got steak Diane and I got a chicken parm sandwich.  He loved his (me too). I completely disliked mine (the marinara seemed like ketchup). Per usual, we got Adams PB cup. <br><br>The total bill was $60, thankfully the gift card covered 25 because the meal was worth about 30.  I&#39;d go back, just to grab a cheesecake to go.

Ummmmm.... it&#39;s amazing! And it has cheesecake. And did I mention it&#39;s amazing!  Had the fried Mac and cheese balls and the lasagna verde. Both were excellent choices. Then grab a cheesecake to go because the meal will definitely fill you up.
The cheesecake is always excellent!   I&#39;m sad that my favorite dish (Stuffed Chicken Tortillas) has been discontinued.  However, the menu is vast and satisfying.

Although the broad menu can be a little overwhelming, you can&#39;t go wrong with any choice.  The portions are large, the presentation is eye-pleasing, and the wait service is outstanding.  You will leave with a full tummy and a happy palate.  I totally recommend this long-time favorite of mine!

We came here after an event, and as expected, it looked packed. We walked in, and the hosts were very hospitable, patient and kind. Our waitress, Amanda, was patient as well (some in our party require it lol). We never had an empty cup the entire time we sat. She diligently checked on us every chance she got, without being annoying. <br><br>Our table ordered the chicken Madeira, the gumbo, the Evelyn&#39;s with angel hair and the Cajun nuggets. Everyone was absolutely astounded. It was great. Four of the six of us had never been here, but all were greatly impressed. I don&#39;t understand why this location only has 3 stars. <br><br>Thanks, Amanda!

Cheesecake Factory is awesome! My boyfriend and I love coming here. The service is phenomenal and the food is always delicious and well-made. Wanted to give a shout out to our waiter Charlie! He was phenomenal. So kind and extremely helpful. You can&#39;t go wrong with any of the waitstaff at Cheesecake Factory though. We love it there!

Love love love this place for a nice reasonably priced meal. They have a great atmosphere that accommodates the casual family dinner or a less than formal date night. Their menu is pretty extensive so be prepared to be overwhelmed with dozens of choices. Regardless of what you have, I assure you that the portions will be more than enough for most. This is one of my wife&#39;s favorite chain restaurants here in the 405. We have eaten there several times and I have yet to order anything that disappointed. Oh... wait - did I mention the cheesecake? Well it&#39;s quite decadent. We share a different piece every visit and each time we claim it as our new favorite.  The one thing I wish they took was reservations since it is always a wait, but if you have the time it will be worth it. Good  Luck and Dare to Dine.

I&#39;ve been to The Cheesecake Factory several times but this time I tried the Steak Medallions and it was delicious! I would definitely order it again. I also tasted the White Chicken Chili which was pretty good too!

So first off, I&#39;ve been eating at Cheesecake Factory since 1997, first in downtown Denver, Jacksonville FL, and OKC. Tonight was probably the worst experience yet. The complaint isn&#39;t on service, or waiting over an hour for a table but the food, and really I can&#39;t believe it. We had the spicy Caesar salad which was the only thing that was tasty besides the bread. Kids food was bland, the fettuccine kid bow tie was dry and flavorless, the kid chicken fingers were ok, our other kiddo had the americano burger and he said it was good. I ate the Mac and cheese burger which came with this tiny fried Mac and cheese ball. My wife on the other hand suffered a dry and flavorless Louisiana chicken and then went with calamari which couldn&#39;t have been more greasy and only like two rings and the rest were tentacles. (The server took the Louisiana chicken off but we paid for the grease trap of calamari)All in all, over priced drinks ($11 for a well whiskey and lemonade) flavorless food and greasy. We only chose the Cheesecake Factory tonight do to the expansive menu and our picky kids, however rest assured we won&#39;t be back. i just wish I had taken more pics.

I&#39;m a huge fan of the Cheesecake Factory primarily for their vast selection of scrumptious cheesecakes. One of my cheesecake missions in life is to try ALL of their cheesecake flavors and still have all of my teeth and no diabetes. With that in mind, I can only try a new flavor or two every year because my sweet tooth craves different things. I&#39;ve tried a lot of the flavors on the menu. I&#39;m a huge fan of the raspberry white chocolate truffle, the red velvet, lemon meringue, dulce de leche, salted caramel, celebration cheesecake, and the Adam&#39;s peanut butter (in no particular order). The food here is pretty good, but there are places locally in Oklahoma that has better foods, so I don&#39;t come here for dinner unless there was a friend&#39;s birthday or work event. This is the only Cheesecake Factory in Oklahoma City metro areas and they get very busy all the time. I&#39;m definitely a fan and I LOVE their cheesecakes.

Horrible experience! Family of 4. Asked the waiter to keep the menu after we ordered. He snatched them out of my hands! He brought the wrong for for my son! The food was not that great, was hoping the to try the cheesecake but we were ready to leave at this point.

Was out first time there.. food was really good, it&#39;s a bit high priced.. but I think most of there food is to high prices.. service was just ok.. and the pet peeve I had there was so many flys .. but I don&#39;t think we will go there again..

We were seated in the nicest area and we were early for lunch so we did not have to wait. Our server was fun and the food was very good. The cheese cake dessert was boxed for us to take home. A fun time for our family.

I went with my co-workers in a group of six. Apparently, this restaurant has difficulty accommodating more than a few large groups, because all the big tables were taken and we were crammed into a booth. Although decor is nice, the restaurant seems to be clean, and our waitress was attentive, I was unimpressed with the Louisiana Chicken Pasta. The chicken itself was tasty, but the pasta was bland; I didn&#39;t eat half of it and it wasn&#39;t worth the price. Members of our group request this restaurant due to the desserts and I&#39;m sure that is where they excel.

The food was hot when it arrived to our table. That&#39;s always a good thing for the wife! It was worth the 20 minute wait though. Our waiter, Andrew, was on his game, despite also serving a large party next to us. I tried something different from the updated menu and had the Thai Curry Chicken, w/brown rice and mangos. As usual, my eyes were bigger than my stomach, so that meant I had to get a to go box. Cheesecake to go also!

No matter which city or state, Cheesecake is always consistent for sure!<br><br>Dining solo at the bar, Andrew my server was amazzzing!  Such a nice guy with an awesome attitude and he was very pleasant.  He was very patient while I was conducting some business on my smart phone =)<br><br>My favorite appetizer is the avocado eggroll and it was spot on delicious.  I don&#39;t know why I like it so much - it&#39;s just fried avocados, but it&#39;s just a staple everytime I eat at CF.<br><br>The burger was delicious.  No complaints!<br><br>I think CF is one of the best chain restaurants in the US.  The extensive menu has something for everyone, the portions are huge, prices affordable, and always has a nice ambience.<br>It&#39;s always a nice option when traveling.

I had a pretty good experience here. Went there for a birthday. They don&#39;t take reservations and you have to be sure that pretty much all of your party is there before they will seat you. <br><br>For the drinks, I got the bloody mary which was decent. Not the best bloody mary I&#39;ve had, but it comes with a celery and it was good to go with the meal. <br><br>I like that they give you complimentary bread and better. Just the plain small packaged butter. But I really enjoyed the pumpernickel bread!<br><br>For my main meal, I got the almond crusted salmon salad. They definitely give you a good amount for the price. I was surprised about that. My salmon came on a bed of kale, quinoa, and avacado. It was good, filling, and not heavy on the stomach which is nice! <br><br>I also tried the crab hash. It was okay. Again, the portion sizes are decent. But, I didn&#39;t really enjoy the potatoes that came along with the dish. It had a weird taste to them. <br><br>Overall, the service was good and attentive. Very accommodating to my party of 10, and they even gave the birthday girl a complimentary dessert! <br><br>I still have yet to try the cheesecake. Too full. (I know, it&#39;s called cheesecake factory and I didn&#39;t try the cheesecake..) But, I&#39;ll be back to try that because they looked delicious!
Here for the National Cheesecake day! <br><br>It&#39;s my second time on this location and I always get great food and service!

Cheesecake Factory is known for a good time with exquisite food. However, tonight I experienced something far from that. I ordered the Parmesan chicken &#34;pizza style&#34; and that&#39;s EXACTLY what it turned out to be. On the menu, it does not tell you the chicken is going to be SMASHED &amp; FLATTENED into a sloppy disc that covers the ENTIRE plate. The bread crust was melting off of the chicken and the chicken was revealed to be grey (in attached photo) In my opinion and my two friends that joined me for dinner agreed that the chicken tasted like cat nip (not the way chicken is supposed to taste). The marina sauce that covered my chicken frisbee tasted like tomato juice. However, our service was great and we were very well taken care of, and the desert is the only thing I would recommend on the menu.

Excellent food with enough portions. A little bit pricey but c&#39;mon the atmosphere and service. It has to be a little bit on the pricier side. My husband always order the same Grilled ribeye and mashed potatoes, I don&#39;t eat meat outside my house so I order any dish that have dish or chicken. We will always be back

I haven&#39;t gone to the Cheesecake factory in a while, I will be going again soon. Ask for Marvin, the waiter was very attentive, and nice, not to much on the up selling. I like the atmosphere, and how it seemed clean as well the bathroom was well kept, nice to see a worker wash his hands too. The food comes out timely and very tasty too. I am a carrotcake critic so I ordered the crazy carrot cake Cheesecake and they nailed it. The clam chowder soup of day was amazing. Grab up the family and go there soon before its too late.
Absolutely loved this place, delicious food, on point service! The bread served on the table was a little hard but that&#39;s my only qualm and that was free so I can&#39;t really complain!
I love this place! I love the small items part of the menu, as I can never eat a full plate! I also love the cheeseburger rolls! Best thing on the menu!

Cheesecake Factory is the perfect place in OKC to hang and dine outside.  I always enjoy what I choose from their menu options, which I should add, is the grandest option filled menu around.  My fav is the White Bean Chicken Chili but I try to explore and tday I had the Pasta Napoletana.  It was delicious and just the right size to not make me feel over full afterwards.

EDIT: I&#39;ve been told that the food doesn&#39;t come frozen. Fine and dandy, but it certainly tastes it at this location. There are restaurants in the city where you can taste the freshness of the food for a fraction of the price. And how &#34;none of the food is frozen&#34; when they have a menu the size of a Harry Potter book is beyond me. <br><br>The food is outrageously overpriced. I&#39;m no fool - this is a chain restaurant. The $20 plates of food come frozen in bags. Tastes good, but not worth the price. I can spend less on a plate at a restaurant that uses fresh ingredients and makes things from scratch. <br><br>However, there are two things to come here for: the cheesecake and the appetizers. We all know their cheesecake slays the game. Their appetizers are some of the best I&#39;ve had at any restaurant and they are large in portion size. The avocado egg rolls and the sauce that comes with them are to die for. And who doesn&#39;t love the mac and cheese balls? Ditch the regular menu. You can easily pick an appetizer and just order that as your entree; you&#39;ll walk out just as full and you&#39;ll probably have spent $10 less per person. <br><br>As far as service goes, it&#39;s always been decent at this location. This isn&#39;t a place I frequent just because of the price outweighing the quality of the food, but I had a gift card and, well, I&#39;m a sucker for a slice of cheesecake the size of my head.
I ate here recently. Good food. Good service. Phenomenal cheesecake. Vanilla Bean is my favorite type of cheesecake. I will probably visit there again...just for the cheesecake.

My first visit to a cheesecake factory was a cloudy fall evening.  I ordered The Bacon Bacon Cheeseburger. It came with fries. <br><br>I nibbled on the bread they brought to the table while I waited. <br><br>The dark wheat bread had a soft but chewy texture with caramel notes that left a smoky after taste.  It seemed a shame to relegate it to pre-dinner munching.  it is worth a starring role. <br><br>The white bread was far chewier and crunchy with a glutinous texture that spoke of peasant roots and hinted at a missed calling to the status of crouton makings.<br><br>The atmosphere was upscale but noisy with dim lighting that went for intimate but achieved an open crowded vibe.<br><br>The burger arrived. I opted for mayo in lieu of the tartar sauce like not so &#34;special sauce.&#34;<br><br>The bun was soft but we&#39;ll toasted. it was high class enough to hang out in a joint like this but down to earth enough to be a proper hamburger bun.<br><br>The beef was soft but pallid. Light on beefy flavor The patty left most of the flavor to the bacon.<br><br>The Bacon itself was charred past the point of crispy and tasted only a moment from being burned.<br><br>The cheese was delightfully creamy and gave quiet support to the rest of the burger<br><br>The fries were lightly golden brown and delicious... They were right out of a dictionary definition of American French fries.<br><br>My overall opinion is tentative worth ordering again if you&#34;&#39;re comming here with friends and want a burger instead of something else. <br><br>If I ever come back I will explore the menu for something else.<br><br>I took home a piece of Strawberry Cheesecake (It didn&#39;t seem right not to try the cheesecake at a place called The Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>The filling was mildly tangy with a modified creamy taste. The crust was slightly soggy with a grainy texture and pleasant molasses undertone to the graham cracker crust. It was a rather good commercial version of the Italian inspired desert.

Ordered to go. I&#39;ve eaten here many times, always ordering the Louisiana pasta. Been satisfied. Well ordering To go today, it was a hot, greasy mess. Actually a warm greasy mess, as it was not temperature hot when they finally brought it. Please drain the grease next time.
Always great! Had the Vietnamese summer rolls and they were delicious! Although our waitress was a bit rude but what can you do /-:

Just had dessert to go. I went in on a weekday at 4:30pm and it wasn&#39;t packed. The cashier was kind and patient and gave me great advice. Their chocolate cake in the display fridge is definitely worth trying. It&#39;s rich, but it&#39;ll definitely satisfy that craving. Can&#39;t speak for the rest of the food and service though (hence the lack of a star)

Here is a restaurant that cares little for guest satisfaction and even less for how they treat their employee. As long as the General manager, Rick is piling in people he could care less how your food tastes or how long it takes to get to you. However the biggest issue here, is Steve the Executive Kitchen Manager, a man who truly loves to hide a good sexual harassment ordeal, or an underpaid employee having to miss work because they cannot pay to wash their uniform until the next day. But don&#39;t worry even if the uniform is covered in cat urine, this man will say it&#39;s &#34;cool just come to work&#34;. <br><br>I could list a million reasons why not to eat here at this particular restaurant but the biggest of all is the unsanitary practice of cooks in the back, from going to the bathroom, and right back to cooking missing the sink. To dropping food on the floor and throwing back up on your plate. <br><br>Do not support this restaurant or the horrible people who run it. There is plenty food in Oklahoma City with class, playing style, affordability and of course, taste that isn&#39;t chain oriented.

So sad to say that after waiting for couple hours for seating and foods. They also mess up our order, one of my friend has to wait till everybody about to finish for his food.<br><br>30 minutes for them to split the ticket :(. OMG, this&#39;s the first time in my life that I have to wait and deal with such many troubles at a American restaurant.

The food was great. We ate there to celebrate my birthday and we had a wonderful time. Our  waiter and the rest of the staff were great and very attentive! The Mac N Cheese balls were delicious and so was the Snickers Cheese Cake. We will definitely eat there again!

Food is always great here, I love there menu. The service is always great from the servers. The wait for a table isn&#39;t that long, but food does take longer then most places. I know they get busy and I would hate for the quality of food to drop because they rush your food out so I will stop complaining lol. Try the Nashville Nuggets they are delicious and they will get you full. Only 5.50 for ten of them.

Brunch was disappointing last weekend. <br>Seating was immediate. <br>Bread was never brought. <br>The menu is too big (it actually has page numbers). <br>Overpriced food took forever. <br>Drinks were warm and food (omelet and potatoes) cold. <br>Waitress never returned after food was dropped off and neither will I.

First time at this location in OKC but every time I go to a Cheesecake Factory it&#39;s always a great experience. I had great service and food. The waitress was on point and paid attention to details. The Cesar salad was good and the chicken and seafood gumbo was off the chain. Man I&#39;m telling you. If you haven&#39;t tried the gumbo try it with white rice. Mmmmmmmmm

We come here regularly every 2-3 weeks. I always order the Grilled Ribeye steak, never disappointed. Kids also love their chicken straps but my wife is not that big of a fan. I took one star off because I always run out of my Raspberry lemonade and seems like they try not to refill more than 3 times :(

Great service! Had a party of 8 they sat us within 10 minutes of arrival durning lunch time. We were celebrating a recent birthday and a family vacation. The food was all wonderful as was the cheesecake. We will definitely be back next time we are in town. Highly recommend the crispy crab cakes!

Out of all the generic chain restaurants, Cheesecake Factory is on point and I don&#39;t even get dessert!<br><br>The menu is enormous and serves all types of food ranging from American, Italian, Chinese, and Mediterranean. I&#39;m pretty sure you can get almost any type of mainstream food here.<br><br>The food is consistent, if overpriced, but you don&#39;t go to this restaurant for value. Anyone can find something appealing on the menu here. It&#39;s probably the most robust and varied menu I&#39;ve seen in OKC.<br><br>Its steep prices are somewhat made up for in huge portion size.

I love Cheesecake Factory. I also appreciate that they are all pretty consistent. If you&#39;ve been to one Cheesecake Factory, you&#39;ve pretty much been to them all.
