Huge menu, huge portions, huge gap in your wallet... but the same delicious food, strong drinks, and good service that you know and love.<br><br>This is the first one I&#39;ve been to where our party of 5 was immediately seated on a Friday night. I was totally expecting to wait at least an hour. I&#39;m not sure if that&#39;s normal, but I&#39;m not complaining!
Came for brunch. Food was good, but definitely not in proportion to the prices. Service was alright, server seemed a little overwhelmed.

Had a terrible experience. Service was not good. Had a philly cheese steak sandwich. Something from the first did not seem right. However thinking it would get better I kept eating. Meat was very tough and full of gristle.  Ate most of it and immediately did not feel good. Told server and then manager that sandwich was not good. I wanted them to take off the bill. Manager was rude and would not take it off.  Will not be back. Was sick when I got home. Does not normally happen as I have an &#34;iron&#34; stomach.

I&#39;ve always enjoyed The Cheesecake Factory.  The menu is extensive and the portions are large.  I&#39;ve been to several locations around the country and the food is usually pretty good with the exception of the pizza I had at the location in San Francisco.  That pizza was some of the worst I&#39;ve ever tasted, in fact, so bad that I actually sent it back and requested another entree.<br><br>Here are my two issues with this restaurant:<br><br>1.   They do not have a traditional New York cheesecake with a firm, dense texture as opposed to more of a pudding like texture.  Very strange indeed.<br><br>2.  And, most important to me.  Why do they put the silverware directly on the tables?  That is simply gross.  Interestingly enough, they wrap the eating utensils in a cloth napkin for the outside tables, but do not do so for indoor dining and it just sits on the table itself.  Even IHOP or Denny&#39;s will place the eating utensils on paper placemats.<br><br>I have mentioned this issue to my servers and have even written a comment on their website.  They all say they wipe the tables down, but have you noticed that they use the same wet rag at each table?  I&#39;ve seen way too many kids and adults putting their hands and arms all over the tables after they cough and sneeze and then, after the table is cleared with this soiled, wet rag, down go the eating utensils for the next party.  It&#39;s just not very appetizing.  <br><br>I can&#39;t believe I&#39;m the only patron that has noticed this disgusting practice.  I always request they bring me the &#34;wrapped&#34; set of utensils which they do without any protest.  Nevertheless, the practice is a black eye on a mostly decent restaurant if not for this one issue.  <br><br>To me, until the management resolves this issue, the restaurant only deserves two stars.

The lunch we had today was excellent as was the  service.  They have a skinny menu which was interesting.  I had the skinny beef medallions with mashed potatoes, asparagus, and tomatoes.  It was excellent.  My wife had the skinny asian salad which she sail was excellent.

This review is for lunch. Had a great Cobb salad and my date had a very fresh grilled salmon. Service was good and attentive. The deep chocolate cake we split had very fresh whipped cream on the side and was way more than the two of us could eat. Price was a little higher than average but not overwhelming. No iceberg lettuce in my salad and plenty of grilled chicken and bacon.

So I went to eat here st cheesecake and the service was ok but I waited 2hrs for my food and it&#39;s bugs in the bathroom plus my marinara sauce taste like ketchup and the calamari was cold don&#39;t go

I&#39;ve always loved the cheesecake factory. This was my first time at this location and I loved it. I had no wait time, and was given awesome service. I ordered the tomato basil pasta and it was so good! Plenty for leftovers the next day. My boyfriend got the bacon-bacon burger and finished it all! Will definitely return sometime.

This place has never let me down. I&#39;ve been dining here at Cheesecake Factory since they opened in Beverly Hills, California. This is my go to place whenever I get out of church late and don&#39;t want to deal with the &#34;CHURCH RUSH&#34;. I only wait about 10-15mins. They have the best drinks (Strawberry or Raspberry Lemonade). With a menu that is over 10 pages long you won&#39;t have a problem finding something you like or want to try for the first time.  <br><br>My Favorite Things:<br>Meatloaf<br>Cashew Chicken (hold cashews w/Mashed potatoes)<br>Miso Salmon<br>Chinese Chicken Salad<br>Kobe Burger<br>Grilled Chicken Avocado Bacon Sandwich<br>Bang Bang Chicken<br>White Bean Chili<br>Avocado Eggrolls<br>Buffalo Blasts<br>Cobb Salad <br>       -----------------------Let me stop there cause I could keep going-------------------------<br><br>The staff are extremely nice from the greeters to the bussers. We always have GREAT times here!!!!

Today we had Kane help us today. He was a great worker and he answered all our questions in a professional and genuine way! Because the weather beautiful out, we sat outside and we def enjoyed the few. With both had some mojitos for lunch: pineapple and passion fruit mojitos! Both is a must! I actually enjoy the passion fruit mojito a bit more then the pineapple bit both are delicious. For appetizers, we had calamari which is WORTH IT! best calamari I&#39;ve tried (although cheevers, sushi Neko, and red rock are amazing). For our main, my boyfriend had the shrimp and chicken stir fry with brown rice and I had the chicken and mushroom pasta. Both was a specialty dish and both were delicious! The menu was HUGE so we will have to come back and try the rest of the menu. I was not disappointed at all about today! It was amazing! Thank you Kane for your service today!! I hope I spelled ur name right lol

Place really gone downhill as to both service and cost. Sat at bar. Inordinate time to be served. Also big upcharge on food for a simple substitution. Food quality still good. Just not the experience I&#39;m used to from this chain. And very, very expensive for just two people. Almost $80. =(

Wish I could rate this place as good as their Red Velvet Cheesecake tastes. We ordered Chicken Marsala and Quesadillas, both were just okay. The service was very slow, very long time too get drinks and food.

Not a big cheesecake fan, but they have some awesome cheesecakes and a great selection to choose from. Their food is good a well. The flavor is good and big portion size.  We ordered the crispy chicken and shrimp with pineapple and the hibachi steak, both were great. There are many Asian dishes, but not authentic if that&#39;s what you&#39;re looking for.

Great service, great food! We usually get the salmon and it&#39;s amazing here...the mashed potatoes really good too. The bread is always warm and makes my carb loving soul happy. If you choose to end your dinner with cheesecake you won&#39;t be disappointed!

A very novelty restaurant. I think this place might have been the bomb dot com back when I was in middle school. I didn&#39;t visit until I was an adult and figured out cuisine. The menu is lengthy, but in my opinion the food is sub-par and expensive. The desserts are adventurous, but just loaded with sugar and frou-frou instead of depth. I feel like I&#39;m describing a bad first date.

Normally we love Cheesecake Factory but today was sub-par. They lost our order, the fries tasted about 3 hours old, and they had several parties all crammed into one small place. It was rather disappointing and not up to standard.

Food is going downhill this is the third bad for you to let them last time I&#39;m going to go there our waitress was really good we never asked for anything she took her time getting our change so we are ready to go she put the check down and walked off waited like a full 10 minutes seem like ever she came back and got it and it took like 10 minutes to get our change she was good

I always am delighted to get to choose this establishment for a nice casual dinner setting. My server Flor was elegant and efficient while my party was there and the Parmesan chicken pizza style is quite delightful. Make sure to go early before they run out of the dish when you go. My only complaint is with the slim choices for beers on the menu.
Having lots if fun eating good food with the best little hillbilly I know. Good family time.

Firecracker salmon for an appetizer was da bomb! Daughter ordered grilled salmon..bland tasting. She didnt finish. I ordered from skinnyliousious menu of shrimp pasta. I finished my plate. Angel pasta was a tad undercooked..but edible. Got the strawberry cheesecake. Service was good and attentive.

Had a great experience. The waiter was excellent! He was professional and very timely even though they were extremely busy. I had the Thai Wraps, shrimp scampi, and chicken marsala. Everything we put in our mouths was good!

My visit here today was OK for a pretty established place as the cheesecake factory. I went this afternoon at 4 for an early dinner with my fiance and we were surprised at the lack of parking spot and how busy it was at this time. <br><br>The reason? I believe it was because of their great lunch special which lasts till 5 pm!! I got the spicy Chipotle chicken. They say lunch portion but I couldn&#39;t even eat half of it.<br><br>I saw a sign in the front door and it said there is happy hour from Monday to Friday from 4-6pm on select appetizer being 5$. Considering their appetizers are usually 10 dollars this is a great deal to go with friends for an early dinner and try their wonderful small dishes. <br><br>One thing I always am sad about is that I eat so much I never have room for dessert!! I have tried the majority of their cheesecake but my favorite is the Hershey chocolate one! !! It&#39;s rich enough to satisfy your chocolate craving without being too overwhelming!

I honestly was pleasantly surprised by the food here. <br><br>We got Lettuce wraps to start. They were really good, and the presentation was really nice as well. <br><br>For my main course, I ordered the ribeye. To my surprise they cooked it properly and it was actually really juicy.<br><br>The dessert I got it what was the most memorable. We got this mango lime cake that I could not get enough of. I could honestly eat a whole cake of these bad boys.<br><br>The service was also really good! <br><br>I definitely recommend checking this place out.

Decent food at decent prices. Staff are friendly. Few hiccups include takeout staff team could use a little coaching in managing their station. They were a little overwhelmed with dinner rush. However all in all the food here is good, plentiful and reasonably priced. Order was accurate and worth the long wait.

Nice atmosphere. Good menu selection.<br>My wife and I were seated quickly on the patio amid a Friday night throng of other waiting customers waiting for seating. I overheard the host mention a 20 minute wait time for indoor tables.The server was wonderful and very attentive. The down side for me was the food. I ordered the Charbroiled Choulotte Steak. A cut of sirloin that was triangular on its cut and  roughly five inches long.I asked for medium-well and received a rare-medium serving. The server graciously returned it for a bit more cook time.Although the steak had good flavor, it was very tough to chew from being a bit overcooked on its return. My side of mashed potatoes were fair....nothing exciting. A little pricey for food that I would consider mediocre. If we return, I&#39;ll more than likely stick to the desserts!

I&#39;m extremely disappointed in the service and food. Visited during lunch, and while busy was still seated fairly quick. Waitress couldn&#39;t have cared less about taking our order or refilling drinks. I lost count how many times she walked past our table with empty glasses on the edge. Once we did finally made the order it came out cold. The spinach and cheese dip was bland with over fried chips. We took a few bites and pushed it aside (what a waste of $13!), the burger was over seasoned and greasy and the Alfredo literally made me sick to my stomach and I barely ate half of it. After the service and the sub-par food I had no interest in ordering any desert. Our tab was over $50 and was not worth half of that.

Have been to this restaurant, in OKC and in other cities, dozens of times and this was my most disappointing experience. I sat at the bar and ordered a salad for a late lunch. Waited 25 minutes, salad was flavorless and the used place settings of other guests sat on the bar well after their departures. I know they are better.

So look, Cheesecake Factory is certainly not going to be confused with fine dining any time soon. Here&#39;s one thing I&#39;ll throw out about them: Most chains figure they&#39;re going to do one thing well, and then they&#39;ll add a few throwaway dishes to cover the tastes of the folks who aren&#39;t interested in whatever they&#39;re most &#34;proud&#34; of. This is how you wind up with people like my [redacted], who will think nothing of ordering a glass of Chardonnay at a run-of-the-mill Mexican restaurant.<br><br>Cheesecake Factory, on the other hand, has attempted to create mass-market, easily replicable and average-quality food that will appeal to the tastes of ANYONE who walks in the door. Any four random pages of their menu book would be more than enough for your average chain, and they have way, way more than four pages. I&#39;ve had the food more than I wish, and while it isn&#39;t great, it is usually at least average and keeps that standard across the ridiculous variety of stuff they&#39;re churning out. And I also give them bonus points for having the word &#34;factory&#34; in their name. It&#39;s not like they&#39;re hiding what they&#39;re up to, are they?<br><br>You need great service to get to &#34;above average&#34; for this kind of place, and I&#39;ve never had that at this location. But there are chains out there doing way less ambitious work, and not doing it as well.

As a California native, I&#39;m a big fan of Cheesecake Factory. I miss this place and I make sure to stop by every time in California. This location is not the Cheesecake Factory I know. I came here on a Friday night with my wife and kid. You always expect a wait so that was no problem. We got seated and it just took a long time to get some service. The table beside us was seated a few minutes after us and someone greeted them immediately. They received their drinks fast too. After all that, we finally got some service. As it turns out, we had the same server. I guess he could only tend one table at a time.<br><br>My wife asked for the nutritional menu. It&#39;s common practice for her to ask and receive one. The server didn&#39;t quite know what that was. He said he would check. He comes back and says they don&#39;t have one available. Ok fine. My wife decided to order a turkey sandwich but we were told they are out of turkey. My wife goes to her next option; they are out of that too. We order margaritas--by far the worst margaritas we&#39;ve ever had. We could have drank margaritas out of a can that tasted better.<br><br>Like I said, I&#39;m not sure what&#39;s up with this location but I hope people don&#39;t think they are all like this.
This was the best I loved it and there are so many choices I chose the Buffalo wing and it was nice and spicy best buffalo wings ever I highly recommend this restaurant

The best food at a restaurant hands down! Delicious crab bites, meatloaf, and chicken Madeira ! This place is always delish and totally worth our drive from Lawton. It is also very clean. And the cheesecake...save room! There is so many different ones to choose from. It is hard to pick a favorite.

This is a pretty solid chain restaurant. We come here only probably about 3-4 times a year, but it is always really good. We visited a few weeks ago, and I got the Thai salmon and I had no complaints. It was cooked really well and the sauce on it was really good. This place has everything (literally almost everything) on their menu; it&#39;s THE biggest menu I&#39;ve ever laid eyes on! <br><br>I deduct a star for the atmosphere. This is a very large place, and it gets pretty loud inside. Although, I will say they do have a patio outside that I have never sat at. <br><br>Other than that, this is a definite &#34;go-to&#34; for Cheesecake (obvious reasons). The Oreo cheesecake is my favorite-- it&#39;s pretty much like heaven in your mouth.

Food poison, yes my wife and I took my son out for his birthday on Tuesday, my wife and I shared 3 appetizers and 3 hours later we were both sicker than we ever thought we could be. As a result we missed our plane home, had to stay in the hotel for another day and keep our rented car for another day. This place is a HEALTH HAZARD!<br>I gave it a 1 star because there wasn&#39;t a minus 10 to select.
After a long day at work and a whole lot of Christmas shopping, ended our evening at The Cheesecake Factory! Amazing cocktails, food, and service!

First off, the parking here is ridiculous. It is impossible to park in their poorly designed lot so just plan on parking at the mall and hiking to the restaurant. They have 6 &#34;to go&#34; parking spots, which is ridiculous. <br>The restaurant is hot, loud, dark and the wait staff is rude. The menu has way too many items on it. <br>The food is overpriced and mediocre. <br>I&#39;ll never be back

We had waitress bailey and she was an amazing waitress, she did not check in too much, she did not check I&#39;m not enough. She always refilled my drink whenever it was getting close to finished. I had the salted caramel cheesecake and I don&#39;t usually eat cheesecake but this cheesecake was phenomenal. I also got the shrimp fettuccine Alfredo and it was amazing. Overall a great experience 5/5 stars

Cheesecake has been my favorite dessert for as long as I can remember, so of course this place is one of my favorites. Their cheesecake is to die for! The food is also pretty great! If anything, though, come for the cheesecake. That&#39;s what makes this place memorable.

We tried it again Sunday afternoon about 4pm. The service was great.  Food was great. We ordered 2 appetizers, 2 entrees, and a piece of cheesecake. Everything was cooked wonderfully. Only problem was they forgot to bring a salad before the entrees, but overall it was much better than our last trip. The food was delicious! I got the Korean Fried Cauliflower and Skinnylicious Veggie Burger.

Poor Service. Be prepared to wait for your waitress/ waiter for at least 20 min after seated. They messed up and forgot that we where there. The manager apologized and took our drink orders. Then they forgot again! We finally saw the manager took our order for starters and dinner. The dinner came 35 min after and the starters came 10 min after our dinner! <br>We did complain and they did offer one of the appetizers for free but regardless the service in this restaurant really needs to improve. <br>Food is up the CheeseCake Factory. Just not the service.

Large menu with great selections to choose from. Known for large portions, elected to order off the slimmer menu. Perfect for Seniors because it has smaller portions that satisfy. Some of the best mix drinks in town.

Heads up, this place is near the mall so you may experience less than desirable waits and service due to the employees overwhelmed with the masses awaiting their deliciousness.<br>Yes this place is great to chow down then walk off the calories or shop then relax with their encyclopedia of a menu. Some of my favorite appetizers are the Avacado rolls, white hummus, bang bang shrimp. Their pasta Da Vinci is delicious. And I&#39;ve tried most of their cheesecakes so you&#39;re gonna have to go with what flavors speak to you. If you&#39;re a wino,  try their red sangria. I&#39;m pretty sure I drink pitchers of that. So delicious. Don&#39;t be intimidated by the options as some people are. It&#39;s broken up so just find what flavors you&#39;re in the mood for and I&#39;m sure your waiter can steer you into a direction that you&#39;ll enjoy.

Excellent cheesecake!!! So many varieties to choose from to include low carb options and gluten free options as well as sweetened with Splenda option. Something for everyone! You are able to be seethed for dining or grab and go cheesecake. Friendly service. Clean and fun atmosphere.

Cheesecake Factory has great service and huge variety to select from in their menu. And their food is pretty good. But I have to emphasize &#34;pretty&#34;. It&#39;s not great. However they are asking you to pay for great food and delivering pretty good. <br>There are so many great local places that specialize in the different foods offered here whose food is GREAT and will most likely be cheaper.<br>It just doesn&#39;t stand up to the competition.

First off, if you come here and don&#39;t get cheesecake, your wrong.   I failed by not taking a picture of our desserts (Reese&#39;s, lemon and Raspberry, and carrot cake cheesecakes).  I ordered the fried catfish dinner, came with mashed potatoes, green beans and corn.  The seasoning on the cat fish was really good and you could tell the corn was right off the cob.  My wife ordered the Baja chicken tacos, which were amazing and the lime cilantro white rice that came with it was really good as well.  Overall great dinner, just hold back on the entrée&#39;s and save room for dessert.  One thing that bugged me a little, but isn&#39;t necessarily bad, was that the menu almost had too many options.

So, this place was different than what I expected. I has expected a restaurant atmosphere, and not a huge seating area where every server was wearing white, and there was a 2 hour wait!! Guess what?? We sat at the bar! Haha! Take that, people waiting on a booth! Bartender was great, and was very personable. She explained menu items, made my friend a FABULOUS Margarita that wasn&#39;t even on the menu, and gave us a very good first experience! I will be going back, AND sitting at the bar area next time. <br><br>Food was really good. Had the crab dip, and wings. Pretty darn good!! Smores cheesecake was so large, we really didn&#39;t have room for it, but it was fabulous! Ready to go there again!

The Cheesecake Factory has some of my favorite food but I had a horrible service experience. Came in, got sat, we were sitting there for 10 minutes before we were even greeted to get our drink order. My boyfriend ordered a Diet Coke and halfway through drinking it he noticed there was A DEAD FLY IN THE DRINK! We quietly notified our server and he immediately took it back because we weren&#39;t trying to cause a scene. He said he told his manager(I doubt it) and said he would come talk to us. But a manager never came. And when we got our check... he still charged us for the Diet Coke. Nothing had been comped. And we weren&#39;t expecting a free meal but seriously... got charged for a Diet Coke that he drank halfway through with a dead fly. Ya. Nice.

The restaurant decor is nice and clean but a little dark in lighting. It was a little packed but the food and service was great and we didn&#39;t wait long at all to be seated or get our food. If you don&#39;t get a cheesecake after dinner make sure to get one to go! It&#39;s worth taking home. I will return again for another meal at this restaurant.

Service was terrible! We waited for a long time before being greeted by our server. He was at the bar getting drinks for the group of 4 girls sitting next to us. They dropped the &#34;F bomb&#34; like it was the only word they knew! Thankfully my granddaughter wasn&#39;t paying much attention to them! Took a very long time to get our drinks. Dinner arrived about 1 1/2 minutes after appetizer. So we barely touched it. The server boxed our leftovers to go. He failed! He didn&#39;t put any of the sauces on the leftovers. We ordered cheesecake&#39;s to go. We got our check, paid our check and then sat there for 12 minutes waiting for our cheesecake. We eat here quite often. Food is always great! The last few times we&#39;ve been we&#39;ve had bad service!!!

I wish I could write two reviews for the Cheesecake Factory. One for the food and one for the desserts. The food is just ok. It&#39;s not bad but it&#39;s not my favorite place to eat. The menu is a little overwhelming, but it is a great place to take a big group because they have everything from pizza to tacos. <br><br>The cheesecake is 5 stars! I have come here just for dessert several times. The choices are endless and the flavor is great! I know they have other desserts, but I pretty much stick to the cheesecakes.
Fast service, great food, great environment, great attitudes, just a pleasant experience. 5 stars.

I LOVE The Cheesecak Factory. I&#39;d say at any location the food is 5 stars or very close to it. At this location the service isn&#39;t very great, unfortunately. I normally chalk up bad service to a bad day, but the last three times I&#39;ve been here I&#39;ve felt like my presence was a nuisance to each of the servers. When you walk in you can feel the tense and depressing atmosphere. We went a couple of days ago and the service was even worse than normal. During this visit they forgot the chicken in my son&#39;s pasta, no big deal. I showed the server and she took his dish and came back and told me that there was chicken on there, but they&#39;d make him a new plate. Umm, you saw that there was no chicken in there! I was speechless. Just apologize and fix it. Why is that hard? The server did do a complete 180 and became very friendly, chatty, and wanted to be helpful...when she came around with the check. Anyway, the food is delicious and I hope they change things up around there to make it a more pleasant experience for customers.

Having never been to one of these, we finally went for a Sunday lunch. The restaurant was about 3/4 full and wait was about 20 minutes.<br>  Service was pretty good for our party of 6. Maybe I was expecting too much but I found the food only fair and about average for a chain restaurant. Had asked for a bread refill when entrees came but we never got it. Meal took an additional 20 - 25 minutes to get to us.<br>   Had some of the cheesecakes for dessert.. Again, they were ok but nothing I found exceptional.<br>  I found on the bill that soft drinks were $3, lemonade $4 and regular coffee was also $3. Average food and unexceptional desserts, even if a bit overpriced based on ingredient, quality and taste are something I can live with. But such over pricing on beverages is a deal breaker for me and tipped the scales.<br>  Overall, it was merely an acceptable experience but the value and experience for $150 just wasn&#39;t there to warrant a return trip.

I&#39;ve been to this cheesecake factory before and the service was fine. I went back today and our server was rude. We had an older server at first but for some reason she was replaced by Sydney S. after our original server took our orders. The original server put in the wrong salad for my friend so we didn&#39;t blame Sydney for it. The food was good but nothing spectacular. I ended up sharing the lemoncello cream torte for dessert. The mascarpone was beyond bitter so I asked Sydney if that was how it was supposed to taste and she said yes. I&#39;m pretty sure something was wrong with the cake but she made me believe that the mascarpone  was meant to be bitter beyond belief. She saw that I was displeased by it and asked if I wanted something else but before I could answer, she walked off. I don&#39;t think she was too happy with the fact that she had to take our table but that didn&#39;t give her an excuse to be rude. Before this visit we were deciding between Whiskey Cake or Cheesecake factory, we should&#39;ve went with Whiskey Cake as their food is better.

Went there for lunch with parent. The food was excellent. She had the chicken sandwich. I had the pasta with ship and mushroom. The only complaint is the salad I order was dry and no dressing, I had to Oder extra ranch. The other thing is the salad waitress was so. Other table got their food before ours, when we order first.

Me and my Wife visited Cheesecake Factory on July 30th, half priced cheesecake day! We chose to sit out on the patio during the sunny afternoon. At this time the restaurant was very busy but our waiter helped us to the best of his ability and was very polite the entire time. <br>We got our menu and was shown the specials. Something new we noticed was the availability of the lunch menu on weekends now. This is new for most restaurants we&#39;ve visited and was a nice option and something we&#39;ll take into consideration for next time.<br>Overall we greatly enjoyed our meal, the food was flavorful and the perfect temperature. It&#39;s always disappointing to go to a busy restaurant and get cold food, but here it was on point. Another plus to this trip was our table-bread was actually warm! Our cheesecake was delicious and really cured my sweet tooth for the weekend.<br>The only downside to our trip to C.F. was service. It had nothing to do with our waiter or the waitstaff that helped us, but more on the organization of the waitstaff. It seemed for the entire patio of at least a dozen tables, there was only our one server. He would have to carry out orders for three different tables at a time to keep caught up. Me and my wife are pretty patient, so we expected to be there awhile. But it was easy to see that some customers were getting irate with the lack of service. Maybe it was the heat...<br>Overall we&#39;ll be returning to C.F. Again in the future and venture more from our comfort zone and try some new foods to review!

Went on a Saturday early evening around 6pm.  Surprisingly, got seated within 5 minutes.  The service was impeccable and excellent in every way.  The food, not so much.  I had the Evelyn&#39;s favorite pasta, and while full of eggplant and artichokes, plus other veggies, it was drowned in oil and and make the veggies soggy and just okay, at best. My friend ordered the Chicken Castarella and the chicken was excellent with a fab lemon sauce. The asperagus was again, over cooked and oily, and the mashed potatoes were over worked to make them paste like, versus velvety.  The Coffee and Creme cheesecake was the only thing that shined about the meal and met expectations, other than the aforementioned service.  If you are eating there to to get cheesecake...just get the cheesecake to go and dine elsewhere.  Theses were basic dishes that should have been easy for an established restaurant to perfect. Instead it was greatly expensive for a sad meal and great dessert.

So disappointed! This is usually our treat night restaurant. We went on Saturday evening early to beat the crowds. You can usually count on great service, great meals, great desert... and a fairly large bill. I don&#39;t mind that bill thing if all the other characteristics are in place, but Saturday night was a complete fail on their part. We started out with one server and after our order was placed, we had someone new. Our drinks were never refilled and we rarely saw our server. My daughter ordered the BBQ burger with the sauce on the side (pretty difficult huh). It came out fully drenched in BBQ ranch sauce. My daughter and I received our meals but our server said he would be right out with my wife&#39;s meal (chicken madeira). So we waited....and waited...and waited until a manager walked up and said her meal was served to the wrong table. He apologized and refilled our drinks because our waiter was no where to be seen. Several minutes later we were getting antsy because we were going to be late for our movie. Several more minutes pass and here comes the manager with her food. He offered to buy us a piece of cheesecake but we explained we were running late for our movie. He then offered to discount (not delete) the cost of her meal. It seemed like his biggest concern was getting off without giving a freebie. My wife said we would take the discount. We hurried through our meal to get to the movie. Our waiter then appeared briefly, just long enough to drop off the fully priced meal. Apparently the manager WAS really concerned about his margin. He never got that &#34;partial discount&#34; applied to our meal. I think he knew we were, at that point, in too big of a hurry to wait for a corrected check. For your attention to your margin, Mr. Manager, you purchased this review and a former customer. I hope it was worth it. If money doesn&#39;t grow on trees at your house, think twice about making this your treat night restaurant.

Decided to give this restaurant another chance after about 7 years of swearing to never go there again (different location, different state). We were not disappointed. The menu is not lacking in choices (almost too many actually). It has a nice variety of things to choose from for even the pickiest of eaters. The food quality has definitely improved over the years. The server was excellent, not overbearing and always seemed to appear when we needed him. The desserts were outstanding but as a helpful tip, you may want to share with a table mate or you will be taking half of it to go.

So disappointed with their meal serving and quality. House nacho with chicken had no chicken on top. With 15 dollar appetizers, burned chips and cold melted cheese on top was really disappointing. On top of that our entree, which was chicken serve with white or brown rice, had table spoon of rice in middle of chicken curry.. It&#39;s looks like rice spice like side for big bowl of chicken curry.. it&#39;s not worth the money.. do not recommend any friends except dessert.

I don&#39;t normally review chain restaurants, but the service at this location is out of this world. My friend and I were looking for a restaurant that served late and we found The Cheesecake Factory as we walked out of the mall. We walked in and were seated immediately. Our server, Laura M, was one of the best servers I&#39;ve ever had. She was attentive, patient, and accommodating, especially when she learned about my dietary restrictions. She made us feel right at home, so much so that I&#39;d recommend asking for her by name to anyone going to this particular location. <br>I did have one complaint, but it had absolutely nothing to do with the service. The tile floor was hazardously slick throughout the restaurant. I was concerned about face-planting on the way to our table and every time I left my seat. It&#39;s like there was grease smeared all over the floor. Honestly, even if this was never remedied, it wouldn&#39;t scare us away. People like Laura will always bring in repeat customers. She&#39;s spectacular and I&#39;ll be back even if it means I have to crawl to my table.<br>Anyway, fix that floor and I&#39;ll update this review to 5 stars.

We arrived at 4.30p on a Saturday. Since there are five of us we weren&#39;t bothered by a 15 minute wait. Axel was our server and seemed to care less, although he was super attentive to the table of three right next to us. When our food finally did come it was only three plates of the five. We waited six minutes for another plate then the last plate showed up four minutes later. The kicker is that it was the kids meal that arrived last. At the very least get the child&#39;s meal out first...how hard is it for chicken strips and fries?!  There was a table of seven near us and amazingly they managed to get all of their food at the same time. The food itself was average; good but not spectacular for the price. The cheesecake is always good.

If I could give it a 0 Star I would. I ordered the four cheese pasta, and the spinach dip. Not only was it overly priced but it was terribly cooked and tasted so bland I had to dump salty on it to even taste anything and to top it all off I&#39;ve been sick ever since I ate it vomiting multiple times.

Probably my favorite chain - it is so consistent, wherever you go. My favorite menu item is the chicken medeira - it is fantastic. All of the cheesecake is wonderful. I love the key lime. Anything I have ever ordered has been tasty. A little pricey - but very delicious.  The atmosphere is very nice here - pretty decor. Nice location if you have been shopping.<br><br>I like to meet friends here for lunch when I am in town.

They couldn&#39;t just take the gnocchi noodles back and apologize, they had to insult my professionally trained palate!<br><br>First I would just like to say that I have been preparing various types of pasta since  I was 8 years old starting out under my mother and grandmother in the kitchen; with that being said I stand almost 30 years old and I know exactly what al dente pasta is and how it should be achieved depending on which pasta is being prepared.<br><br>Today around 2:00 pm I stopped in to pick up a dinner portion of Fettuccine alfredo with grilled chicken to go, to share for lunch. What I was served was something reminiscent of gnocchi in fettuccine form. This culinary faux pas may happen for a number of reasons, one being the water to noodle ratio is incorrect, (not enough water to noodles) which was most likely the problem here. <br>I placed the food back in the original container and returned for a refund to be insulted by some person who didn&#39;t even tatse the food in order to qualify to have an opinion on the dish. How dare you?<br><br>Next time, apologize, then offer to make the food properly, and if you are seriously sorry offer a free soft drink or dessert. Never insinuate that a customer doesn&#39;t comprehend what a basic dish of anything should be. You take the payments so take the payments and mind your manners, do not tell me that people enjoy eating rubbery chewy doughy pasta, those people and you apparently need to make pasta-mush-gum paste in their own kitchens on your own time  because as a  restaurant you should set the bar higher than that, you should know better, you shouldn&#39;t be wasting my time, and your customer service should be basic if not better. I paid for fettuccine not your idea of edible play-doh or your crass opinion in general. Al dente does not equal gumdrops. Figure it out.

Takes god damn 45 min for 4 seats when their was empty booths. Service slow and terrible customer service. Save yourself the time and dine elsewhere. Food was awful. My shrimp and chicken tasted dry and the sauce they used tasted like pineapple juice just dumped on it.

We visited this restaurant on a Saturday at noon with my husband and two small children. The wait was at 15-20 minutes and we got seated 5 minutes into the wait so was a relief. Here comes the frustrating part. The hostess sat us down and I asked where my highchair was and she said she would bring it right out. I don&#39;t like to sit down with my 13 month old unless he is in his highchair otherwise once the highchair arrives he will only want to be in my arms. Something any toddler mom can understand. I am standing there for about 5 minutes while the hostess continues to sit people and no server in sight. I finally walk up to the hostess and she said &#34;sorry we are out&#34;. While she is saying the word &#34;out&#34; she is walking away from me not allowing me to ask how long my wait would be. I go sit down. Finally 10 minutes later our server arrives to take the drink order. Long story short I ate my entire meal with one hand while holding my toddler in the other. Incredibly frustrating having to do that while paying $17 per plate and $7 for a kids meal. I did ask the server and even the manager 2-3 times if there was one available during our meal and the answer was no every time. I am never visiting this place again. <br><br>P.S IKEA has highchairs for $15 incase you don&#39;t want to ruin another tired moms meal again.

It&#39;s a shame one cannot post without giving a star...that explains my star.<br>Approximately eight to ten times per month, I eat a grilled artichoke from The Cheesecake Factory.  Tonight my husband stopped by to get carry out and much to my dismay, the artichoke was very different.  Not seasoned at all, just boiled in water and tossed on a grill for grill marks.  It was so awful I couldn&#39;t eat it at all.  My very patient husband took it back to explain that it had none of the usual delicious heavy seasoning.  He brought back what looked like a seasoned one but as I delved into it I realized the seasoning had only been sprinkled on the outside leaves.  Always the seasoning has been in the interior leaves as well.  Same blah artichoke....I&#39;m throwing it out but angry enough to write this review. <br>This is the third disappointment in a carry out meal, otherwise I would just let it go.  Mentioning a problem to management has been useless so YELP, there you have it.

Cheesecake Factory is known for its cheesecake obviously. I always love my cheesecake from there. Especially since we are located in OKC, it&#39;s nice to have great cheesecake available. The food is okay, but I mainly go for the tasty cheesecake.

The menu is massive, with lots of choices, even for vegetarians. Discovering that I had more than one option was the best part of our visit. The service was just awful. The waitress was super dismissive and kept looking everywhere but at us while she was taking our order. We had to ask her repeatedly for basic things like silverware, bread plates, napkins, and sugar. Once we got our food, she didn&#39;t come back; we had to flag down someone for our check. This was annoying, but the worst part of our visit was undoubtedly the food. I had the veggie burger. It fell apart pretty much immediately and the flavor was kind of weirdly sweet. My kids had mac and cheese and bowtie alfredo; both were undercooked with watery sauce. <br><br>I might go to Cheesecake Factory again if I had a gift card, but not if I was paying for it. It was really mediocre.

I like Cheesecake Factory every now and again. This CF is exactly like any other CF I&#39;ve ever been to. Just like the one in SLC and just like the 2 I ate at in AZ before moving here. There is nothing unique about any particular CF, it&#39;s a chain restaurant but one that I tend to enjoy for my birthday. <br><br>We had a pretty good experience as far as food goes. In fact service and food were all fantastic until my bff said &#34;It&#39;s her birthday&#34; and not for the obvious &#34;they&#39;re gonna sing and embarass me&#34; reason. It literally took 20 minutes to get my cheesecake with &#34;happy birthday to you&#34; written in chocolate on the plate&#39;s rim. <br><br>Other than that: I requested pasta with my samlon instead of mashed potatoes. While the request was granted without any fuss the noodles were undercooked and stuck together. The sweet corn tamale cakes though, were so so good! <br><br>I&#39;m not a big fan of corporate restaurants. I typically prefer and dine with local companies, just sayin&#39;

My family and I went to the Cheesecake Factory for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. We all ordered our meals but they brought my son&#39;s meal 20 minutes before any of the other meals...even before we received our appetizer. I ordered the meatloaf and mashed potatoes...my meatloaf was raw in the middle and I was sick the next day. We also found something foreign in our cheesecake...string we believe. We were all so disappointed from beginning to end. We hope this cautions people from this restaurant.
Overprice on everything, went with the &#34;Famous Factory Meatloaf&#34; bland no real flavor. You can get a whole cheesecake for the same price as a slice. Wait staff was excellent.

I usually try to stay away from chain restaurants because I think the food lacks the extra love and attention needed to make a good meal, but I had a $40 gift card to The Cheesecake Factory and I needed to go to Penn Square Mall anyway. My experience today reconfirmed (for the hundredth or so time) my distrust of chains.<br><br>Let me start with the good news - the cheesecake at The Cheesecake Factory is amazing. Every dessert I&#39;ve ever had from here has been consistently, sinfully delicious. They have a huge variety of cheesecakes to choose from and the display is enough to make my mouth water. I&#39;ve tried several different kinds, but my favorite is the simple classic cheesecake with strawberries and whip cream. I know they get all of their desserts shipped in. Nothing is made in-house. This is usually a big food turn-off for me, but the deliciousness of the cheesecakes wins me over. I love it! Even though you&#39;re looking at around $7 a slice, I think it&#39;s totally worth it. I can&#39;t say the same about the non-bakery items.<br><br>Ok, so I will say the complimentary sourdough and dark honey-wheat bread they serve is great. I was really hungry when we got there and happy to find out I didn&#39;t have to wait for our food to get a little nibble in. However, after the bread, my meal went way downhill. I ordered scrambled eggs with potatoes and a bagel with cream cheese. The eggs looked and tasted like edible plastic and the potatoes were over-processed and bland-tasting. My favorite thing was the bagel and cream cheese, but even the bagel was burnt a little bit. I really haven&#39;t had a good food experience any time I&#39;ve visited this restaurant and I have come to discover that a ridiculously long menu usually equals blah food as is the case here.<br><br>Also, although our waitress was sweet and somewhat attentive, I think the servers might be overworked here. Everyone seemed frantic and frazzled. And why do they make them all wear white everything?!? Not a good look for frazzled wait staff in my opinion.<br><br>I guess the moral of this story is, BREAK THE CHAINS unless you are satisfied with bland food. But do go in and pick up a cheesecake if you&#39;re in the area. You won&#39;t be disappointed with that.

We were in okc because we had some things to do around town. And we decided to have Cheesecake Factory and of course it was good as always. I really don&#39;t understand the not so good reviews at all because everything I have ever had there is very good. Today I got the Louisiana chicken pasta it was so so good. Very flavorful. No complaints at all. My husband had the chipotle chicken pasta that is what he always gets when we do get to a Cheesecake Factory he loves it and he loved it here today he said the taste has never changed. My kids had the pasta napoletana and it was very good as well and all of the pasta dishes had so much food. We also got the egg roll platter for our appetizer and all the flavors were fantastic. I also got a raspberry lemonade and omg it was the best tasting lemonade I have ever had. For dessert I got the mango key lime cheesecake and it was so so good the key lime part was so tart but it was very good. We will definitely be back again next time we are in town. And the service was very good we never had a issue with our waiter he was nice and helpful. My husband asked him about what pastas were spicy and he helped him with finding the ones that were.

Ok, The Cheesecake Factory does not take reservations and will not allow anyone to add their party to the wait list unless the entire party is present. We walked in at 1215 with a party of 9, 4 adults and 5 children. We were told the wait would be 30 minutes max. At 40 minutes manager approaches me and tells me party in our seats are eating dessert and it should be another 10 to 15 minutes. 20 minutes later, after we see a party of 9 seated that arrived well after us, I approach the manager and ask him how much longer as we have been waiting over an hour at this point.  He looks at us with a blank stare on his face and although he did not admit the fact he had skipped over us (either by mistake or on purpose) I realize he had as he again walks through the entire restaurant looking for a differant place to seat us. By this time my wife&#39;s furious and the children are starting to melt down being bored and hungry. The manager strings us along another fifteen minutes making our entire wait over 80 minutes!! We have never had a bad meal here, service has always been spot on. Joe, waiter, took great care of us, and although still seething with anger I took care of him as well via tip. Meals, dessert, two drinks came to $100. I won&#39;t be back. Any restaurant that does not take reservations, or call ahead, or allow one person to sign up party without entire party being present, AND THEN EVEN SCREW UP A WAIT LIST, does not get my return business. We were treated like badly behaving livestock waiting in the shoot to be castrated, one after the other, then sent on our way. I am so very sorry, yes i goofed that up bad.  Is there anything i can do to make it up to you....anything, just say the word! Cheesecake Factory but this pain won&#39;t go away this time. I won&#39;t be back.

I normally love Cheesecake Factory. Here in OKC, we were seated within 5 minutes, which is good bc no one was there. After we ordered, we waited about 20 min for our food, which is fine but server was in such a hurry to flip his table, he wanted to box up our meals a few minutes in. Food was ok, overpriced for the quality. Cheesecake was yummy, as always. Server wanted our ticket paid before we ever got dessert n then offered to package it up quickly. Whole dinner was rushed. We were in and out in 50 minutes for a $100 dinner and almost half of that was waiting on three entrees.

My husband and I almost always come here on a regular Friday night date night. We love LeAnn F. as our server and specifically request for her each week we come. She takes such great care of us. The food here is so great. We have not had one bad meal yet. The wait was over an hour and a half tonight but well worth it. :)

Corn fritters didn&#39;t taste like corn, just deep fried batter and the pizza had just enough sauce to give a red tint. White chicken chili is just big chunks of chicken in a thick sauce. For the price of the food that isn&#39;t acceptable. Great service rose the review to a 2!
Great food, great service and of course they have great dessert, strawberry cheesecake was awesome!
Great service and amazing food! Yes, it is pricey, but who doesn&#39;t love cheesecake? The general manager stopped by our table and was very nice to us! Will return!

On rare occasions, I love to over-indulge at the Cheesecake Factory.  So last night, when I was pulling into OKC, OK, and my friend suggested it for dinner, I was all game.  :)<br><br>This CCF is no different than the others, other than it was a lil less hectic feeling.  It&#39;s a huge restaurant that is kept very clean and has beautiful, classic decor.  My friend and I sat at the bar so we could chat, watch the game and enjoy the night away from the restaurant bustle.  The bartender, Kaitlyn, was super cute and nice (just the way my friend likes em) and when our food came out, it was delicious as always.  <br><br>I like to order the Black Pepper Jamaican Shrimp.  It&#39;s a lil spicy and always tasty.  I followed it with a Lemon Raspberry Cheesecake, which will take me 3 days to finish because my friend ordered his own, the pecan pumpkin seasonal cheesecake.  All was good!<br><br>Thank-u, Cheesecake Factory, for the dependable, tasty food and service!<br><br>See ya there!

The food here is delicious! I&#39;ve gone many times for dinner, but I met a friend most recently just to have a slice of cheesecake. The waiter was really nice. When we were ready to go, I asked for a box to take the rest of my cheesecake home. After I asked for the box, I never saw the waiter again. About 15-20 minutes later, and after the restaurant closed, a different waiter asked if I needed a box and I said yes. I never saw him again either. I finally took my plate up to the cheesecake station and asked for a box. The woman behind the counter was super super kind and boxed it up for me, even adding more whipped cream. I felt bad because we needed up staying about 30 minutes after they closed, but I wanted to take my food home! I will definitely go here again, but the service may not be the best when they are about to close.

Service was great! I have been coming here for years and nothing changes which is a good thing! The food is always excellent and the drinks are always strong like I like them! When u drive 3 hours for some good food that lets you know this is place to be!!!

The food is good. The menu is so big it&#39;s daunting but they have options for almost anything you could want. I think it&#39;s overpriced. It&#39;s always packed so it&#39;s best to come in the mid-afternoon in between lunch and dinner hours or else you won&#39;t be able to find a place to park and you&#39;ll have a long wait.

I ate at here 5-12-15. This was my first time to eat at a Cheesecake Factory. I was soooo disappointed! Our service was horrible. Our waitress was terrible! She never refilled our drinks. Never came to check on us. She was very rude when we waved to her &amp; asked her for refills. The food was mediocre. The sauce was good the pasta was good but my shrimp was way overcooked, tough, and chewy. The only reason I am giving two stars is the cheesecake. It was phenomenal! It was a large piece, creamy, fabulous! Everyone at our table got something different  for dessert and it was all fantastic. My entrée was  $18, my margarita was $10.50, and my white chocolate, caramel, macadamia nut cheesecake was around $7. It is a pretty expensive place to eat. If I ever go back it will be for the cheesecake only and I will get it to go.

Food was good, service not so much. Erica did not go out of her way to be a good server. She split the check without asking and then when I asked to put them together, she said can I just run  them separate. I could tell by her body language that she hates her job.

I wanted to do an update for this chain. I went here recently again after shopping with my husband. My husband had the carbonara which he said was not carbonara and did not taste good. I had the lettuce wraps which they didn&#39;t even bring out to me until ten mins after my husband got his meal. The manager however did apologize and asked me if I wanted a soup or salad while I waited, but I declined. Anywho.. my lettuce wraps only had one tiny piece of chicken, and was not satisfying. The cheesecakes however have always tasted yummy. I usually get the Godiva, yum. Bottom line is dine some place else and get dessert to-go here.

I have to jump on the band wagon and ask, what&#39;s the big deal about this place? the Orange chicken was def Orange and sweet with no other flavor and the avocado eggrolls were bland. This was strike 2 so I won&#39;t be back

This place is very clean and the atmosphere is nice.  Our wait was a little long but we got there right at 6:00.  Waitstaff was very polite and helpful.  The menu is huge and can be a little intimidating when trying to decide.  I would definitely eat here again.

I believe that Yelp should adopt a negative star capability...  just a suggestion. That being said I typically never post anything to a websites comments that can be viewed as disfavorable because I feel like any restaurant can have an off night. However, when the staff is less than helpful when food is brought to the table frozen in the middle for one member of my party, and the plates are completely cold for myself and two others, an apology and a replacement entrée  is all that is needed. When are our server finally brought the two replacement chicken Bellagio&#39;s after waiting an additional hour it was completely drenched in oil. Now being that I waited two hours to eat I went ahead and had a few bites despite the egregious service that I received, only to be made physically sick due to all the oil that in my opinion was given out of spite. I spoke with 2 managers that did not acknowledge the cold food. One person in our party never received their original order, and they received the replacement entrée that was frozen in the middle. No one apologized or an the original entrée that was offered never made it to the table.  There was not any acknowledgement for the lack of food service by our waiter as well.  I will not be visiting this location ever again. There are a lot of options in Oklahoma City that far surpass this culinary experience and receiving bad service at a major chain, i.e. (The Cheesecake Factory)  is not worth the time or money. I hope other people have a better experience at this location because frankly mine was deplorable.

Ever have a waiter that really went out of his/her way to make you feel like you were inconveniencing them?  I asked our waiter, John M. if we could have a booth instead because my friend&#39;s chair was uncomfortable.  If looks could kill!  That dude was practically seething the rest of the evening and not even hiding it.  Very sarcastic.  On a positive note the was good but it took a little longer than average for entrée.

Just had my Birthday lunch here, worst visit I have ever had. Waitress disappeared for about 15 minutes. She would say &#34;Do you need anything else?&#34; Then not even come back with what I asked for. Food was less than what I have come to know from Cheesecake Factory. My calamari was burnt and all clumped together in a giant ball. Half of which was actually chicken tenders when you started pulling it apart. My appetizer, bread and my meal all came out together. Heaven forbid I ask for a straw. I had to ask for a refill.  Didn&#39;t even order the Cheesecake I wanted before I left because I was just over the terrible service.

For all of the hype that this restaurant gets my experience wasn&#39;t too bad. We went on a Monday night so, thankfully, there was no wait (which, on the weekends I hear, can be terrible). Our hostess sat my date and I at a tiny, two-person table squeezed in between two full tables. One of the tables was full of very loud teenage girls obsessed with selfies. <br>Anyways, back to the food. I asked for a water with lemon, pretty basic, but never got a lemon all night even after asking the waiter multiple times. I ordered the shrimp BLT and a side salad. The salad was a good mix of greens with a very yummy, chunky blue cheese dressing. The sandwich was massive! It had thick strips of crispy bacon and large slices of tomato, although the tomato had not fully ripened yet (yay green tomatoes!). There was very little shrimp which was disappointing because let&#39;s face it, shrimp is the whole reason for living!<br><br>Next up, the cheese cake!!! I ordered red velvet cheese cake and my date had the cookie dough. They were both pretty epic. The cookie dough cake has actual cookie dough in the middle! Wow. The red velvet is worth the $10 and it&#39;s so huge that I had cheese cake for the next three nights. <br><br>All in all, I would recommended this place to someone during a weekday. Nice atmosphere (unless you get placed next to high school girls), friendly staff, and yummy food. A bit pricey but even if you just go for dessert it&#39;s worth it.

Love this place food is always amazing service is almost always perfect.. this last time I requested another shot un my drink. It was really weak. The server told me I wasnt going to taste the alcohol.. I simply asked her for another shot, after I told her I didnt want to see her anymore I got a new server and my simple request was fulfilled... I will be back often not to let one bad server kill the awesome atmosphere here..

Being my first time in this city and this restaurant The Cheesecake Factory is definitely on my return list. The restaurant had a nice feel to it and was very relaxed. I cannot express the level of customer care demonstrated by the waiting staff. My waitress in particular, Micala, was &#34;the bomb&#34;. She was easily available, very personable, and informative. Definitely would recommend to a friend!

I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory many times over the years. I don&#39;t think the food is amazing, and the cheesecakes are good but nothing I crave (I&#39;m a baker myself so it&#39;s pretty hard to impress my sweet tooth). Food is predictable and consistent, so it&#39;s a good place for a crowd where everyone has different tastes. There&#39;s pretty much something for everyone. I gave four stars because my husband&#39;s favorite dish is the Steak Dianne, and it&#39;s pretty darn good. I&#39;ve always received good service here, though it can be a little slow with a large lunch crowd. The lunch portions are still pretty large and will fill you up, though I&#39;m not sure if it&#39;s the food or complimentary bread that fills me up more. If I had to pick a cheesecake though, it would be the dark chocolate cheesecake, though I can&#39;t remember its specific name. Mmmmm I love dark chocolate!

This Cheesecake Factory has, unfortunately, gone downhill lately because of bad management: poor service and food not prepared well!  Go to Whiskey Café around the corner for a much better dining experience.

The best restaurant. They never dissapoint. This place is clean and the waiters are very friendly. Im in this place once a week and orders either miso salmon or shrimp scampi, all these years I have ate in this place, I have never once had bad service. This is my go to place to eat.

Typical chain. Nothing special. The food is decent. The portions are HUGE! The service can be hit or miss. You&#39;ll either get someone who goes above and beyond or someone who forgets you&#39;re there. <br><br>The best thing here is the cheesecake obviously.

Their food and gigantic menu are consistent with all the other Cheesecake Factories around the country. Even though the outdoor seating areas overlook the beautiful mall parking lots, they do try to make it as nice as possible.<br><br>I&#39;m probably in the minority of diners here because we never get dessert, but their cheesecakes look amazing.

Been to many cheesecake factories, love them. However, at 11:30 on Saturday we were seated at a long row of tables very close seating.<br>I do not want to eat within 1-2 ft of a stranger. I asked if we could sit somewhere more private. The hostess looked at me like she did not <br>understand me. I repeated it. She said no booths available. I said ok.<br>Manager came over and asked if we wanted to wait on a booth, I said no<br>Just did not want anyone next to me. He said he was going to fill up the restaurant (of course). I felt that he he came over to let me know that he did not need my business so we left. Made me soooo sad.
This place was great. I really like the food and the service was accurate and delivered in a timely manner.

I would give a better rating however Managment and staff isn&#39;t doing their job of keeping customers in order that are waiting on a table.  Tonight I went in to the bakery to get a cheesecake, people were everywhere, there was no path to get into the restaurant to put your name on a list to get a table or to get to the bakery, people were packed like sardines waiting on a table, I tried my best not to push anyone however my body was in contact with another body from the moment i walked in the door, if an ambulance was to come and get someone in need it would take them a good 5 minutes to get into the restaurant passed the door and they would be pushing people the entire way.  This was aggregating and super annoying to attempt to just buy a cheesecake from their bakery, in front of the bakery you couldn&#39;t look a the cheesecakes on display because customers were standing in front of the case and there was no where for them to go inside the restaurant, there was plenty of room outside.  There were people in front of the register where i usually pick up the cheesecakes and you have no idea if they are being waited on or waiting for a table, nobody would move, this experience sucked really bad.  The staff is always friendly, the cheesecake i got for the family for dessert was great.  I&#39;m putting blame on management for extreme unorganization, this is dangerous, the fire marshal needs to be called.

I ate there yesterday and got food poisoning from the fresh salmon. Up all night with green apple two step. Told waitress somethings was funny about the food, she just discounted the statement with offering a substitution.

Worse service Oklahoma City Cheesecake Factory.  People who were seated after and next to us were waited on and received their food first.  But it gets worse.  These people finished their food, got their dessert and bill before we ever received our order at the table.  I went to notify the manager that we had not received out food.  And, like the manager could not understand the problem.  Our order finally arrrived and the waiter explained the glitch which was in the computer, but he never bothered coming over and explaining the situation until after the manager was notifed.  So it was nearly 30-45 mins before we ever received our lunch orders (sandwiches and salads -duh!).  And the manager nor waiter ever offered any compensation or free anything.  I won&#39;t be going back again.
Favorite place. So many choices. All the deserts are great. Everything tastes fresh and service also usually great.
always consistent on the service and food drinks are good also just a basic all around great place can get super loud at times but its tailorable.

Had a great experience here yesterday.  the food was great and our server was amazing. Tall girl I believe her name was Victoria, truly went out of her way to make our order right for us.  Even gave us a great suggestion for desert that I loved. Ask for her if you want a great experience and great food.

I don&#39;t get the hype. It was OK. Pricey IMO. I ordered a sandwich and it wasn&#39;t very big width wise but was stacked so high I barely could take a bite which I hate! A slightly bigger bread would make it easier to eat. I had a slice of cheese cake which was tasty but nothing amazing.

My husband, child ,and I chose the Cheesecake Factory for our family day/my birthday.  Huge mistake. It was a busy Sunday morning. I expected it to be busy like it was. We got seated quicker than I expected. Our waiter came to our table maybe 5 minutes after we were sat. He took our drink orders. We waited 10 minutes to get our drinks. He also brought us out some bread and we finished it before he could even come back and take our order. The Sunday brunch sounded wonderful. I ordered &#34; fried chicken and waffles Benedict &#34;. My hubby ordered a burger. We have a 17 month old daughter so she would just share with us. We waited and waited for our food to come out. Our waiter never offered more bread. A table seated after us got their food first. Finally our food arrived. It looked great. Big portions. Unfortunately I wasn&#39;t a fan of my food. I managed to get down half a waffle and that was it. Our waiter never came by to see how we were doing or how the food was tasting. When he did come by he cleared our plates and asked if we&#39;d like dessert. I did. He brought us by the menu again to choose what we&#39;d like. It took him a very long time to return to get out order. We had been waiting a long time so I just ordered a slice of cheesecake to go. All in all we were there for 2 hours and the service was slow and inattentive. Huge disappointment. Wish we hadn&#39;t wasted our family day on this restaurant. We even drove an hour out of our way to eat there.

This place is pretty good for a chain restaurant.  I went there for a late lunch and was seated quickly.  I ordered the pasta carbonara and it was very good.  My dining companion order the herb-encrusted salmon and he said it was good, as well.  We also got dessert--kahlua coffee cocoa cheesecake (or something like that) and THAT was amazing!  I love the huge menu here, I always feel like I have lots of options.  The negative, though, is the ambiance.  It&#39;s always really loud in here.  Get a booth if you can, as it&#39;s generally quieter.

If I could give Cheesecake Factory less than 1 star, I would. I never post anything on yelp because I feel like any restaurant can have an off night. However, when the staff is less than helpful when food is brought to the table frozen in the middle and the plates are completely cold, an apology and a replacement entree&#39; is all that is needed. We spoke to with 2 managers that did not acknowledge the cold food. One person in our party never received their original order, and they received the replacement entree&#39; that was frozen in the middle. No one apologized or an the original entree&#39; that was offered never made it to the table.  There was not any acknowledgement for the lack of food service by our waiter as well.  I will not be visiting this location ever again. There are a lot of options in Oklahoma City that far surpass this culinary experience and receiving bad service at a major chain is not worth the time or money. I hope other people have a better experience at this location.
I sat at the bar and enjoyed watching the Thunder in the playoffs.  I had a cold beer and enjoyed tasty pot stickers as my appetizer.  The service at the bar was excellent.

Over worked chain.  They lost our reservation, then told us they don&#39;t take them.  We did get free dips, but they weren&#39;t the highlight of our experience.  Service is always questionable here and I&#39;ve only been 3-4 times in my life.  Half our table received their food in 15 minutes and the other half it took almost 40 minutes for some soup and salad. They also added gratuity  - which I hate - we are extremely generous tippers, until you add gratuity.  Everyone always seems like they&#39;re running around like crazy and are flustered. Not an enjoyable dining experience.

My wife and I LOVE this restaurant! I wish I could give it a sixth star. Some of the best food in the metro can be found right here without the exorbitant prices you might find at some of the other local restaurants. Here you can expect high quality food with the &#34;fine dining&#34; experience without paying fine dining prices. While the lines might be long at prime times without a reservation, the service is always fantastic and the food and drinks leave nothing to be desired. If you want a slice of some of the best cheesecake in the world then get ready for it! Cheesecake Factory has an entire menu of flavors to choose from and we are convinced that there isn&#39;t a bad one to be had! Brunch is served Saturday and Sunday from 10:00am - 2:00pm. We can personally attest that the chicken and waffles are incredible, and on a warm day you can enjoy your meal on their patio if you choose. I hope you give them a try. I&#39;m sure you will not be disappointed.
I love this place, they never disappoint! If you havent tried the ahi tar tare you&#39;re missing out. It is so incredible! Tuxedo cheesecake for me as well!

I&#39;ll probably get hate mail for giving Cheesecake Factory a two star review since the gargantuan portions guarantee a perpetual crowd but who wants hubcap-sized plates of mediocre food? Seriously, I&#39;d rather have a small dish of something that tastes divine than a trough of something that tastes like packing peanuts.<br><br>I also wonder if there&#39;s a Bread Nazi in the kitchen rationing the bread baskets since it seems like bread delivery is random and/or tables worthy of bread are chosen on a lottery system. Service is also a little spotty- wait staff is always pleasant but there seems to be a lack of communication regarding seating since servers seem befuddled at first by your appearance in their section.<br><br>The avocado spring rolls are usually good (hence the two stars) but not good enough for me to return if I&#39;ve got other dining options (or even an unopened can of soup at home).

Yeah, I know people love this place, but I think its kind of overrated. And overpriced. The portions are enormous and after paying close to $20 for an entree you feel kind of obliged to take your little doggy bag back home and try and get a second meal out of it. Admittedly I did go out drinking later that night and it made for some decent 3am munchies. Look I don&#39;t mind paying good money for a meal thats going to knock my socks off but I didn&#39;t find that here. <br><br>Decent cocktails but again more than I really like to pay when I&#39;m at a chain restaurant devoid of any kind of atmosphere. Good cheesecake but honestly... I think I&#39;ve had better.

We have eaten here many times in a number of states. Big menu. Plenty to choose from. Interior is visually interesting.<br><br>Wait staff has always been good.  Yes, it is a chain. But their business plan works. And if you like cheesecake, there is plenty to choose from on that front as well as other desserts.<br><br>The wait on weekends can be crazy. So plan ahead. Usually things slow down by 8:30 if you don&#39;t mind eating later.<br><br>The only complaint I have is that some of the tables are set up very close to each other. And if it is busy, you kind of feel like you are wedged in there with the masses. Not exactly quaint and cozy if you happen to be seated in that section.

Love the new fish tacos! My fav cheesecake is the red velvet.  Service was okay. Our waitresa was anxious to clean the table of things I often wasn&#39;t finished eating. Overall a good place for our date!
Not great. Not bad. Just food. I have had good experiences at other ccf restaurants. This one was a let down. Also, got sick after eating here, possibly a touch of food poisoning!

I&#39;m not gonna lie, this place rocks! I love eating at The Factory! I&#39;ve eaten at this one twice. The first time I ate dinner and dessert...Chicken Parmesan with a mocha cheese cake slice afterwards. A-MAZ-ING! So good! And the wait staff was great. That time I went with some friends and our waitress was pregnant and about to pop at any time. She did so good for being so pregnant that we left and went to Wal-Mart and bought her some baby clothes and diapers and formula and stuff! She cried! It was great!<br><br>The Second time, I went with a group of friends and we had dessert on the patio. So beautiful! The bathrooms are very very nice. The inside is so nice and the place itself is just great. No negatives from me. I highly recommend The Cheese Cake Factory.

Went here for Valentine&#39;s day and had a great experience! The waitress took tremendous care of my table. The food was perfectly cooked and arrived extremely quick especially considering how busy the restaurant was. My recommendation would be to try the Oreo cheesecake for dessert! It was absolutely amazing!

The Cheesecake Factory is by far the best casual restaurant in Okc. The service is incredible and the food is always great.  They have the best selection and the staff always exceeds all expectations of a restaurant!
Worst atmosphere and tacky decor I have ever seen, it is like Egypt meets grandma. The food is so bland and twice my silver wear has been dirty.
Amazing! Great food every time we come in and employees are always clean cut. It is a little pricey, but the food is incredible and portions are huge. And I can never leave without cheesecakes!

Sometimes a corporate chain place is exactly what you need.  If you are going out to eat with a group that has varying tastes, it&#39;s nice to take out the mystery element.  I like The Cheesecake Factory because I know what to expect.  The atmosphere is a little more upscale than your average family restaurant.  Casual enough to be relaxed but just fancy enough to celebrate a birthday or anniversary.  <br>  This location is free standing but next to a large shopping mall.  The menu is extensive so definitely email out a link to the indecisive.  I do like that you can order a lunch special on the weekends.  The portions are still gigantic and their warm bread basket is addictive.  I usually skip appetizers in an attempt to save room for cheesecake but the avocado rolls are really good.  Imagine a mix between guacamole and eggs rolls- the best of both worlds.  <br>  Besides cheesecake, the reason I go to CF is for pasta.  I feel a little less guilty splurging on a bowl of the Fettuccine with Chicken and Sun Dried Tomatoes when I know I am just minutes away from chasing it with a cheesecake induced sugar rush.  I like to get all my sinning done in one sitting.  My sweety likes the steak and eggs on the brunch menu.    They do offer a Skinnylicious menu if you want lighter fare but that just seems like a way to make your table mates feel bad about themselves. Do you want to be &#34;that&#34; guy or girl?<br>  The service was good even though we went during the Sunday brunch rush.  The one thing I would suggest is to ask to keep one menu as that table to browse the cheesecake flavors.  My favorites are the Key Lime, Lemon Raspberry and White Chocolate Raspberry Truffle.  Don&#39;t plan anything too ambitious for about 4 hours after a trip to the Cheesecake Factory- usually a nap while watching TV will help you through the food fog.

Love love love the Cheesecake Factory. We did have quite the long wait, but considering it was Friday night at dinner time I can&#39;t complain too much. Our waitress was prompt in taking drink orders, and gave us plenty of time to look over the ridiculously long menu. Seriously, it&#39;s 15 pages. We ordered our food and only waited 20-30 minutes on a busy night, which is just fine for me- I filled up on some sourdough and pumpernickel bread. My boyfriend and his dad had crab cakes and loved them. Really, they raved about them for days. I had a burger which was nothing special but a good burger nonetheless. Then we all shared Tex Mex egg rolls. Man oh man, I wish I could eat those every day. I love those things!

I love the Vietnamese Spring Rolls! Santorini Farro Salad is my next favorite.  I&#39;ve never been disappointed. Waiters always attentive. Hubby loves the filet mignon. It&#39;s cooked to perfection every time.
Another overrated chain restaurant. Atmosphere and food were mediocre. Save your money, and go across the parking lot to Elephant bar instead.

It is the Cheesecake Factory. I had the grilled eggplant and roasted red pepper sandwich.Phenomenal. My son had the mac and cheese burger. Fantastic. His girlfriend had the buffalo chicken sandwich and my husband had the factory burger. They both enjoyed theirs. The appetizers were yummy as well-firecracker salmon and the artichoke and spinach cheese dip. What is worth mentioning here is the manner in which we were treated. I have been here many times as it is the only Factory within a bazillion miles. It is ALWAYS crowded. This is not a problem for me. I am fully prepared to wait. However, I do not appreciate being rushed. If one is going to spend a hundred bucks for a meal, I think the option of at least wiping your mouth after the last bite should be open to you. We had barely laid our forks down before the bill was received and plates were whisked away.  I don&#39;t appreciated being pressured to leave because the Factory failed to build a big enough building. Of course our waitress got our generous tip-I don&#39;t like not paying- just give us a chance to take a breath before you decide it is time for us to leave.

I don&#39;t want to admit that I went here, but I stopped by last night for dinner with some friends. The wait staff was extremely courteous, especially because we fell into the auto 18% gratuity.
