The menu was huge and took hours to go through. I had a caramel apple cider that was like warm apple pie in a glass. I followed that up with a large house salad and split a vegetable penne. The pasta was cooked perfectly, but the vegetables were bland and over done. Overall I had a pleasant experience and would come back.

This place has the largest menu of any restaurant with all types of food to please anyone&#39;s palate. Start out with the Ahi Carpaccio or the Crab Cakes, then move right into the Bistro Shrimp Pasta, California Cheesesteak Sandwich or the Fresh Grilled Mahi Mahi and finish it off with the Tiramisu cheesecake or the Dulce de Leche Caramel cheesecake, both are to die for!

We went here because we were given Birthday gift cards.The staff was very friendly,our waiter was new to the job,but he did everything he could to make our visit a great experience.The menu is very extensive.My mother in law had the taco salad,it was huge and was very good.My husband had a seafood dish which he said was good.I had a shrimp pasta dish.I rarely complain but the only thing on my plate that was great was the shrimp.The pasta and it&#39;s sauce were very bland and the pasta hadn&#39;t been cooked much.I like my pasta done not just warmed in water.I did take it home and added spices and it was great then ! For the price I don&#39;t think we will be in a hurry to go back. It is a chain with very high prices,more like a fancy coffee shop.I love going to nice places and don&#39;t mind the price if the food is great.This place just isn&#39;t my cup of tea as they say.

We went here while on a business trip in OKC.  We had to wait a bit for a table as it was a really busy evening.  It was definitely worth the wait.  Food was incredible, cheesecake was delicious, and our server (Nick, I think) was very friendly, knowledgable, and took good care of us.   I will definitely come here the next time I have to travel to OKC.
Very over rated.  Sure, the menu is huge, as are the portions.  Unfortunately, none of the dishes are anything more than mediocre.

We get take-out here all the time. The food is really good, but the take-out service is terrible. There&#39;s one guy in particular who answers the phone and is often very snotty; he will actually scold you if you take longer to get there than the amount of time he tells you it will take to get your food ready! We&#39;ve had to wait really long for the food to be ready once we got there, as well. The food is really good though, and besides that one guy and the occasional long wait, it&#39;s worth the trouble.
It&#39;s good but pricey.. but then again, the portions are gargantuan. i&#39;ll go back here for special occasions, but that&#39;s about it.

I generally enjoy a factory of cheescakes, but on this occassion I found it mind-numbingly exhaustive.  Correct me if I&#39;m wrong, but the waiter is supposed to do the work, not the patron, no?  I&#39;m guessing our waiter is new to Cheesecake Factory, if not to waiting tables in general, if not new to the world.   Perhaps he spent too much time under the California sun as that&#39;s the only menial bit of &#34;conversation&#34; I was able to concentrate on before I started gauging my eyeballs in an attempt to remove them from their sockets and shove them in my ears.  How many times are you going to ask me if I wanted meatballs with my spaghetti after I repeatedly ordered alfredo and finally gave up and settled on mushroom ravioli...hold the meatballs.  And if I wanted to be corrected on my pronunciation of &#34;Bruschetta&#34;, which I still maintain has a soft shhh sound to it, I&#39;d consult the Oxford dictionary as opposed to being auditorially accosted with the cacoughanous ear beating of the confirmation that I wanted to start with &#34;Brewsketta&#34;.  The food was palatable, though hardly worth the wait.  Until Mr. Sweet Valley High is more experienced or no longer employed here I doubt I&#39;ll be willing to roll the dice with this place again.  All together now, when I say Mali, y&#39;all say boo.
